sequence: Known as a “ floating fest , ” Lake Wylie Music Fest has performers on land at a private residence, while musicians stay afloat on boats around the lake and a few nearby islands. As the sun rises on Saturday, it’s time for music lovers to get wet. The fest is a five-hour journey, but once you get there you won't want to leave. Lake Wylie is located on the eastern shore of the Winyah Bay in the southeastern part of North Carolina. While some people might say this area is far from the ocean, it's really just an inlet.

ARSENE WENGER last night confessed he passed up the chance to buy Didier Drogba – for just £100,000! The Arsenal boss could have landed the super striker seven years ago, while he was playing for lowly French outfit Le Mans in the French Second Division. But Wenger stressed he was not the only manager to snub a player who went on to join today’s FA Cup semi-final opponents Chelsea for £24m two years later. “Don’t forget all the French clubs watched him,” he pointed out. “Nobody took him. He went from Le Mans to Guingamp.

Although state trademark registration offers fewer benefits than trademark registration with the United States Patent and Trademark Office , state trademarks may provide additional benefits to your business. State trademarks allow you to claim your business name in the name of a state or the United States, rather than nationally. In addition to the additional name protection offered by state trademark registration, state marks also provide some additional advantages. You may register your state trademark with the State of California, as well as the state trademark registrar for any of the other 50 states. State trademarks also provide international protection when used in foreign countries.

The Dallas-Fort Worth Film Critics Association, of which this reporter is a member, has named Moonlight as the best film of 2016, as part of the results of its 23rd annual critics’ poll. The intimate drama that follows a boy living in inner city Miami through three stages of his young life was also given three other awards: best director for Barry Jenkins, best supporting actor for Mahershala Ali, and the the Russell Smith Award, an honor given annually to the best low-budget or cutting-edge independent film. The award is named for the late Dallas Morning News film critic.

California Communities Demand `` Rent Control Now ! '' Efforts to stabilize communities in California with with much needed rent control are spreading from Berkeley and Palo Alto to Los Angeles and Oakland. In each city, a coalition of community-based groups, representing a broad spectrum of working-class, low-income and homeless people has mobilized to create a rent ordinance to cap rent increases at a percentage of CPI (Consumer Price Index) plus 1, 2, 4 or 5 years, respectively. In Palo Alto and Berkeley, the movement has won rent control for over a decade.

John Bennett(July 20), a teacher at Westside Middle School, was upset by the School Board's decision to have teachers teach all sides of any controversy. He is right, of course, that pretending all sides of any controversy are equally valid is nonsense. But a good deal of the issue hinges on our definition of "teaching" a position. If "teaching" means that the teacher merely presents all sides of a controversy as though they were equal in weight and legitimacy, then we are being equal time indoctrinists.

In 1890 , a group of eight large New York City bakeries combined to form the New York Biscuit Company and the first New York Biscuit was made that year , according to a newspaper article. The company was purchased in 1902 by the Pillsbury Company . The company's product was called a ' biscuit'. The name was changed to the ' New York ' in 1908. The product is made from wheat flour , yeast , butter , sugar , salt , eggs , leavening . The biscuits are leavened to produce a lighter biscuit and to increase the shelf-life .

Jack Kerouac cruised the bohemian North Beach neighborhood here in the 1950s intent on achieving nothing less than freedom of the mind, body, soul and written word. Nearly 50 years after the publication of his classic best-selling novel, "On The Road," the spirit of Kerouac, who died in 1969, is back in town at the new Beat Museum. In a modest one-room space sublet from the Live Worms art gallery on upper Grant Street, the museum uses letters, videos, books and photographs to tell the story of the writers known as the Beats.

New Jersey has finally done it. The Republican-led Legislature and Democratic Gov. Phil Murphy have just signed into law a bill that would eliminate private college tuition in the state. Private college tuition is expensive. The average yearly tuition at a four-year public school in New Jersey is $11,200, according to the College Board. ROBIN VAN PERSIE may still leave Manchester United this summer, but it won't be for Qatari side Lekhwiya according to general secretary Adnan Ali. Van Persie's United future remains up in the air with reports suggesting the Dutch striker could be sold this summer. Louis van Gaal refused to clarify Van Persie's future over the weekend, leading to further speculation that the former Arsenal man could be on his way. There's no truth in the news. It had been claimed that Lekhwiya - currently coached by former Swansea boss Michael Laudrup - had put together a £6m-a-year package to lure Van Persie to Qatar.

MANILA, Philippines — House Majority Leader Rolando Andaya Jr. will yield his position to Capiz 2nd District Rep. Fredenil Castro during Monday afternoon’s plenary session. Castro confirmed this to INQUIRER.net, adding that the Camarines Sur congressman would be the chair of the powerful House appropriations committee. “Yes… Cong. Andaya will slide to being Chairman of the Committee on Appropriation,” Castro said. The lawmaker from Capiz said Malacañang, as well as the latter’s probe into the alleged budget anomalies under Budget Secretary Benjamin Diokno’s watch had nothing to do with the change in leadership.

A mother forges her son's signature on a letter of intent. A newly committed Georgia player hoists a live bulldog to celebrate his college choice. A top-rated quarterback tries to avoid an argument by telling his mother - by text message - that he's not picking her preferred school. Those were the highlights, or lowlights, of Signing Day, Act One. Act Two comes today in Rock Hill, S.C., when defensive end Jadeveon Clowney celebrates his 18th birthday and gives his parents what he calls a Valentine's Day present when he reveals his college choice live on ESPN.

Doing business in British Columbia is particularly challenging because of the province’s reputation as a hotbed of environmental and aboriginal activism. John Winter worries it could get worse, threatening $90-billion in planned projects, if the Northern Gateway oil pipeline isn’t built. “If this thing fails it will be a serious and significant issue,” Mr. Winter, president and CEO of the B.C. Chamber of Commerce, which represents 125 chambers around the province with 36,000 businesses in every sector of the economy, said in an interview.

According to a new poll by pro-business policy group the Bay Area Council , 34 percent of Bay Area residents think the city has a high level of tolerance for homeless people -- but they’ve never experienced it for themselves. A majority of those surveyed, 53 percent, have never actually seen a homeless person on the streets. The Bay Area, like the country as a whole, does have homeless people. In 2015, there were an estimated 10,000 homeless men, women and children living in Bay Area cities and towns.

This week, in a closed-door meeting of Congressional Democrats with President Obama, Representative Ed Perlmutter of Colorado bluntly said what has been on many politicians' minds: "Larry Summers. Bad choice." Mr. Obama was visibly annoyed and mounted a defense of Mr. Summers, his former economic policy adviser who also served as Treasury secretary under President Bill Clinton. Mr. Summers, who the president said had become something of a "progressive whipping boy," appears to be a strong contender to succeed Ben S. Bernanke as chairman of the Federal Reserve.

German scientists working on the Wendelstein 7-X fusion device started a series of experiments that could eventually prove the superiority of inertial-confinement fusion over other fusors, such as the traditional tokamak, which have been the focus of most fusion research for years. The Wendelstein 7-X team has managed to sustain fusion at the high temperature necessary to make fusion practical for energy production for over five minutes. This achievement is far beyond what previous teams have been able to do, and may lead to a new, more efficient method of generating energy from nuclear fusion.

Facing a mountain of debt and increased competition from online ( Amazon ) and brick-and-mortar ( Wal-Mart ) retailers , Sears Holdings has filed for bankruptcy-court protection. The company had $10.5 billion in debt and $2.5 billion in assets as of September 30th. If Sears survives the Chapter 11, its assets will go up for sale to the highest bidder. Sears was founded in Chicago in 1892 and went public in 1975. It is one of the most famous retailers in the United States. Its best-known trademarks are Kenmore appliances, Sears Craftsman tool brands, Kenmore and DieHard products, and the distinctive red store logo.

Accompanying the Medal of Honor release this Tuesday, SteelSeries has branded their high-end keyboards, mice, and mousepads with deigns to complement the first person shooter. Accompanying the "Medal of Honor" release this Tuesday, SteelSeries has branded its high-end keyboards, mice, and mousepads with deigns to complement the first-person shooter. The Bridge City Cardinals are the boys 22-4A district champions in tennis. The team participated in the district tournament in Beaumont last week. Taking home the silver medal in Boys Singles was Lorenz Schrader. Schrader played an epic four hour match in the finals before falling 5-7; 7-5; 7-6 (5) to Hardin Jefferson. In the Boys Doubles division, the Perry brothers once again dominated. Camden and Kian dropped only two games in their move thru the bracket. Also in the Boys Doubles, Salvador Torres and Alberto Munguia captured the bronze medal for the Cardinals.

Briefly: Each time we get the chance to pass along a bit of info about Christopher Nolan‘s next film, Interstellar, it is typically just a name, as the details of the sci-fi script are being kept quiet. Matthew McConaughey, Anne Hathaway, Michael Caine, and Jessica Chastain are in the cast, for example, but we can’t tell you much about any of their characters. We know that Nolan’s long-time cinematographer Wally Pfister won’t shoot the film, due to his directorial commitment on Transcendence, but that Hoyte Van Hoytema (Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy) will reportedly shoot instead.

AMD 's Ryzen CPUs offer some of the best bang for the buck , but which is best ? AMD's Ryzen 7 is an 8-core processor with 16 threads , offering a big performance advantage over Intel's 8-core , 16-thread i7 . And the Ryzen 5 is 8 cores , but with half the memory bandwidth of the Ryzen 7 . These new chips will bring competition to the market for desktop systems that can offer Ryzen-level performance at a lower price . But how do you compare a $300 Ryzen 7 with a $1000 Ryzen Threadripper ?

A violent thug has been jailed after he unleashed his American pitbull dog on a man who died six days later from his injuries. Jedediah Williams, 22, punched and beat his victim as he kicked and scratched the helpless animal. Jedediah Williams, 22 (left), has been jailed for six years for animal cruelty after he admitted to a court that he had kicked the victim while the dog was on his chest (right)

Williams admitted the offences at the High Court in Manchester and was given a jail term of six years and nine months.

The U.S. government is charging that Google is systematically paying women less than their male counterparts . Testifying in a lawsuit filed in July, a Google vice president said that it’s the company’s “policy and practice to compensate employees based on their level in the organization.” Those with more experience get paid more, he claimed, and Google doesn’t keep data that would allow it to determine salary ranges based on gender. But the way Google pays its workers is a little more complex than that. In April 2015, Gizmodo reporter Mat Honan wrote that Google had developed a new salary-adjustment policy.

Richard Drew/Associated PressThe normally busy trading floor will be empty on Monday . All United States stock and options markets will be closed to allow traders and investors time for reflection, as the country mourns the massacre in Newtown, Conn., and many of them prepare to return to their desks on Tuesday. As the day passes, the White House plans a national day of prayer and reflection on Wednesday. On Tuesday, the Federal Open Market Committee of the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago meets in Chicago, where it meets only every two years. The Fed is the most influential economic policy-making body in the world.

The OLCC is cracking down on marijuana retailers that sell to minors . PORTLAND , Ore. – A rule increasing penalties for retailers selling to underage consumers has been approved by Oregon Liquor Control Commission . The rule, adopted in early May, increases penalties against retailers for selling alcohol to minors and applies to the sale and transfer of cannabis products, including medical and recreational cannabis . Retailers will be required to follow new record-keeping rules to ensure the age of the consumer who makes the purchase or transfer of cannabis goods. The rules were initially proposed in November 2016.

(CNN) — Portuguese sailors called it the "Gates of Hell." Namibia's Bushmen speak of the land God made in anger. From the air, the bleak shoreline of the Skeleton Coast looks wonderful -- a deep green sea, fringed with surf, breaks over a shore receding into infinite dunes. From land, it's a different story. The Benguela Current rushes in, urgent and strong, hurtling the chilling Atlantic into the fierce heat of the Namib. Whale and seal skeletons from the former whaling industry still litter the coastline -- the source of the region's frightening name.

New Jersey hits day three of its government shutdown Monday over a budget stalemate that's closed state parks — and will likely force the furlough of 35,000 workers. On Sunday, the impasse even inconvenienced Gov. Chris Christie, forcing him to leave a state beach that was on shutdown to the public — but open to his family — because he had to return to Trenton. All nonessential services remained closed as the Republican governor and the Democratic Assembly speaker continued to disagree over Christie's plan for a nonprofit health system that is at the center of the budget dispute.

The right sheet set and pajamas can help you stay cool . Today ’ s memory-foam mattresses do n't sleep very warm, so a set of sheet sets and the right pillowcase are required. As the night moves on and it cools down , your sheets can get a bit chilly, causing you to become cold in the morning. If you live in the colder months, you ' re more than likely to use a heavier set of sheets for your bed. If your house gets chilly, there are different types of sheets available for bedding to keep you warmer in the bed.

Amazon.com's purchase of Austin-based Whole Foods Market is showing up in the wine category. As this year ends, Amazon has shut down Wine.Woot and its own wine marketplace in favor of Whole Foods' expansive wine operation. Now that Amazon owns Whole Foods, a licensed seller of wine, it comes under different state laws and can't sell directly from a producer. As a result, Dallas entrepreneur Matt Rutledge sees an opening in the marketplace. When Amazon.com purchased daily deals site Woot.com, based in Carrollton, in 2010 it also acquired Wine.Woot, a direct producer-to-consumer website that Amazon adopted for its own wine marketplace.

AUSTIN — Rep. Rafael Anchia filed a resolution Monday condemning President Donald Trump 's executive order restricting travel to the U.S. from seven countries, a move he said is unconstitutional and un-American. "The order is unconstitutional because it denies legal status to refugees, immigrants and people from the targeted countries who are lawfully in the United States," the Austin Democrat wrote on his website. "It also denies visas to citizens of the seven targeted countries in an effort to stop the flow of migration into the U.S. It does this through the use of the U.S.’ most valuable and important asset — the visa process."

A high profile heavyweight boxing match at Sands Casino Resort Bethlehem will be broadcast live on NBC Saturday as Tomasz Adamek of Poland and Steve "USS" Cunningham of Philadelphia meet for a highly anticipated rematch. The winner will be in line for a shot to face International Boxing Federation Heavyweight Champion Wladimir Klitschko. “Adamek and Cunningham are going to put up a great fight to be in the number two IBF spot among heavyweights,” says promoter J Russell Peltz. “Adamek won the first time in 2007 when both he and Cunningham were cruiserweights. Now, the stakes are even higher."

One 15-year-old girl from Russia loved sharing her image on social media . She would take selfies whenever the mood struck, post them on Instagram and Facebook, and make them into GIFs. This one was posted on Instagram, but I found it on Twitter. In 2014, one of my clients had an Instagram account with tens of thousands of followers. The account was not hers. She had no idea who the person was who posted her pictures. Her account was hacked. This was the case for a lot of people on Instagram at the time. It happened to me, too.

The Frewsburg Central School board of education received an update Thursday on the capital project that began last spring . The latest estimate from the consulting company that is overseeing the project is a $7.9 million price tag, an increase from the $7.3 million cost originally estimated in the fall of 2017. The increase is primarily because of the amount of labor that was spent on the project to date. The increase in labor costs also is because of the discovery of more asbestos during demolition. The updated budget was presented to the school board at its regular monthly meeting at Frewsburg Middle School, with all members in attendance.

Marine Le Pen, the French National Front political party leader, at an FN political rally in Frejus. French presidential candidate Marine Le Pen is not the biggest fan of the euro. "The euro is not a currency," she said earlier this month. "It is a political weapon to force countries to implement the policies decided by the [European Union] and keep them on a leash. "Look at what happened to the Greeks when they said no to austerity, as they were right to do: Liquidity for the banks was cut off."

Nintendo ’ s ancient Power Glove remains a part of popular culture because , one , it was an epic commercial success, but two, it was a game-changer. The Nintendo Power Glove, developed by Nintendo ' s Research and Development laboratories , launched in 1990 as a promotional tool for the game The Legend of Zelda. The idea behind the technology , however , was not to sell more merchandise, but to sell more software. In fact, according to Nintendo President Satoru Iwata , the Power Glove sold less games than it should have due to the poor marketing behind the technology.

CBS President and CEO Les Moonves has pushed for rights to stream NFL games on the network's digital service. CBS Corp. said it obtained rights to carry National Football League games on its CBS All Access streaming service, allowing the most-watched U.S. TV network to offer its most popular programming online. The multiyear deal with the NFL begins Sunday and will include all CBS coverage of regular, preseason and post-season games in subscribers’ local markets, the network said Thursday in a statement. Financial terms weren’t disclosed. While NFL viewership has declined this year, football remains the most popular programming on TV.

Following the market opening Tuesday , the Dow traded down 0.34 percent to 17,731.95 points while the Nasdaq and S&P 500 declined 0.48 percent and 0.31 percent , respectively. All three indices started the day with losses for the eighth consecutive trading session . The S&P dropped as much as 0.9 percent to 2,839.25, while the Dow lost 0.74 percent, and both of those measures were trading in negative territory, with the Dow down 0.46 points and the Nasdaq down 0.18 points. On the economic front, the Institute for Supply Management's June services index unexpectedly increased to 57.4 from 53.6.

The J. C. Penney Company , the fourth-largest United States retailer , said today that September sales at stores open at least a year were up 5.4% over last year. Sales increased in all five store categories, including children’s wear, women’s apparel, shoes and accessories and home furnishings and decorations. Total sales were up 6.5% from last September. The company said September sales rose in stores open at least one year by 5.5%, and stores open at least one year increased by 6.1% from last September.

No doubt if you are into painting of the artistic kind then you will probably know that artist Thomas Kinkade has become one of America's most famous names. His love of family was so profound that when his business went bankrupt in 2005, his family took him up and carried him through until his death on July 12, 2006. According to a statement released by the family, "He was a loving husband, father and grandfather and he will be missed by many."

The battle over the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau’s new “borrower education tool” unveiled earlier this week is heating up, with the National Association of Mortgage Bankers now joining the Mortgage Bankers Association in calling on the CFPB to take the “Rate Checker” online tool down. The CFPB’s new interactive page has come under fire because it mentions rates and costs without including disclosure items that TILA-RESPA rules mandate for borrowers – annual percentage rate, closing fees, etc. “This tool will do nothing but confuse consumers in their shopping experience,” said John Councilman, president of NAMB.

What Motivates People To Break The Rules At Work? A look at what drives workplace rule-breaking, and when they’re worth stopping or encouraging. You probably know the employee who takes a stack of Post-It notes with him out the door every Friday afternoon. Or the one that takes an ample amount of sick days, but managed the strength to go to the football game. What about the person who’s otherwise brilliant, but bends company policies to her will–and is promoted? We’ve all told white lies in life, and at work.

On April 22, 2014, Hollingsworth was supposed to drop off 20-month-old Aurora Aryana Hollingsworth at a child-care center about 7:30 a.m. But he “forgot her in the car,” according to an arrest warrant affidavit filed by a North Richland Hills police investigator. “This is a disabled veteran who had several things on his mind that day and just forgot,” Lex Johnston of Hurst, Hollingsworth’s attorney, said Tuesday. Johnston said Hollingsworth’s daughter and four children were living with him, and he took the daughter to work, paid for child care and drove the grandchildren to day care or school.

Last week, we learned that the Obama administration is considering other alternatives to stop foreclosures. Today, we have some color on what one of these efforts might look like. It would encourage servicers to reduce struggling borrowers' mortgage balance. Although banks have fought such efforts in the past, it seems that the program could benefit everyone involved. And the best part: it wouldn't take any taxpayer dollars. Of the residential mortgage-backed securities outstanding, about $1.3 trillion are so-called private label notes that were issued by banks and other financial institutions, according to data from the Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association.

To any objective observer , the consensus that exists between Barack Obama and Mitt Romney on the fundamental issues of America's foreign policy is not one based on any deep understanding of the actual foreign policy of the United States. On the contrary, the views of Romney and Obama on many of the most important areas of U.S. international relations are strikingly at odds, and the divergence in their positions is growing. The debate over whether or not to extend the Bush-era tax cuts -- which are scheduled to end Dec. 31 -- was the latest manifestation of the deepening rift between the two candidates.

Many Alberta small-business owners, who have been struggling through a prolonged economic downturn, are hoping the next provincial government will bring relief through business-friendly policies. The Alberta election is April 16 and polls suggest that Rachel Notley’s ruling New Democrats will be replaced with Jason Kenney’s United Conservatives, which have campaigned to scrap the carbon tax and loosen some labour rules that have driven up business costs. Over the past two years, small-business confidence in Alberta has reached the lowest levels ever recorded in the country, according to the Canadian Federation of Independent Business, which has been tracking the measure for about 20 years.

Ellen Lucas has been running the Carson Nugget Nevada Day Classic for longer than she cares to remember . The race is the crown jewel of racing at Lake Winnipesaukee in New Hampshire, which is where she lives when the weather gets too warm in her New England home. This year marks the race’s 50th anniversary, which makes her giddy all over again. It was the first Reno-area horse show that featured a women’s horse show. “It’s a tradition,” she said. “It’s great that I’m still around.”

The first woman was not even a rider.

FABIO CAPELLO is celebrating a happy hat-trick as he leads England into the last match of the season at Wembley this week. The Italy ace, who is closing in on an international debut, scored two goals and assisted on a third from the bench against Greece at St James’ Park on Sunday. The 24-year-old striker is now enjoying his finest spell to date with the Three Lions, who will be aiming for their best ever showing at the Wembley showpiece. The Three Lions now top Group B with nine points from three matches, three points ahead of Ukraine.

Millions of refugees have fled their homes in war-torn Syria since 2011 . President Barack Obama previously planned to resettle a mere 10,000 Syrians . Now, he is proposing to welcome in as many as 100,000 — and even to expand the resettlement program, if Congress approves it. But even though the president has pledged that those who are admitted won’t be considered refugees, the program will still face some of the same scrutiny and criticism it endured after last year’s program, which admitted about 1,600 Syrians in a matter of weeks. Some of these criticisms have been legitimate, but others are exaggerated or misleading.

Shimla, Jan 14 (IANS) It was a bright sunny day in Himachal Pradesh on Monday, with temperatures remaining below the freezing point in many places in the state after three days of continuous snow and rain, a weather official said here. Rain and snow are likely to continue in the state till Tuesday, the Met Department official told IANS. Keylong, the headquarters of Lahaul-Spiti district, was the coldest at a minus 12 degrees Celsius. It saw mild snow. Kalpa, around 250 km from here, recorded a low of minus 8.2 degrees Celsius.

Voting for the eight phase of panchayat elections has begun across the state amidst heightened security. Polling is scheduled to end at 2 PM today. While 43 sarpanch and 681 panch have been elected unopposed, polling will take place for 331 sarpanch and 2007 panch seats, with 6304 candidates in the fray. An electorate of 5,15,121 will be voting for sarpanch constituencies and 4,19,775 for panch constituencies. In this phase, 2633 polling stations have been set up - 550 in Kashmir division and 2083 in Jammu division. Of these, 361 have been categorised as 'hypersensitive', including 171 in Kashmir division and 190 in Jammu division.

BAGHDAD -- The Iraqi government launched an investigation yesterday into the apparent torture of detainees in a secret Interior Ministry prison, which Human Rights Watch says was operated by Saddam Hussein's intelligence service. Iraq's Interior Minister, Jawad al-Bulaydi, said his department was investigating the case, and the prosecutor general ordered criminal charges to be brought "against those who tortured detainees and those who refused to prevent torture and who are involved in the crime of torturing detainees." The minister said he would not comment until after the investigation was completed.

From Madonna to Sam Smith , Taylor posed with everyone ! As was made evident in Taylor Swift 's intro , he's the most talented person on the dance floor (and that's not a slight to his fellow country singer-songwriter, Justin Timberlake. ) So who are Taylor's favorites? It's no secret he's a pop fan, but when Taylor opened his interview with Billboard, he didn't hold anything back -- from Adele to Lady Gaga , he shared his admiration of everyone from Beyonce and Britney Spears to Ariana Grande and Nicki Minaj .

BOB Cole died yesterday . Around 2pm in a purpose-built flat on a Swiss industrial estate outside Zurich , he lay on a sofa. His last thoughts were for his mother and his wife , whom he had not seen for ten days. She had told him that they were going to the theatre for the last time and that he would never see her again . He was 56 . His mother , Alice , died of cancer a month ago. His wife , Susan , called him twice , but he did not answer the telephone. She did not ring again.

Banking giant Standard Chartered on Tuesday announced a return of dividends for shareholders after a two-year hiatus as it reported a surge in annual profits following restructuring and cutbacks. The Asia-focused lender said it would pay out a full-year dividend of 11 cents per share, citing "improving financial performance and strong capital". It also said pre-tax profit jumped 175 percent on-year to $3.01 billion in 2017. Shares in the firm rose almost two percent in afternoon Hong Kong trading, having been in negative territory before the results were announced during the break.

The Fox Sports commentary team covering an Australian Boomers basketball game have been left in a state of shock after an all-in brawl played out live on air. Matt Russell and Aussie basketball legend Shane Heal were calling the game between the Boomers and the Philippines in Bulacan last night, when a scuffle between two players from the opposing teams led to punches, kicks and chairs being thrown as the fight escalated. Both Russell and Heal were in disbelief as the wild scenes involving players, officials and fans played out in front of the TV cameras.

The Economic Research Department of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka says that according to provisional data , the overall economic growth for 2015 was 3.9 percent compared to 2.4 percent in 2013 and 1.2 percent in 2012. However, this was only part of the news. The official economic growth figures for 2015 were based on data that only took into account exports. The Central Bank’s report for last year, issued in January, said that domestic demand was the main driver of the economy’s growth. There were also several other factors that contributed to economic growth in 2015.

Mission of Burma: Signals, Calls, and Marches / Vs.
Thirty years later, Mission of Burma still sounds like the future. Mission of Burma is a band with a lot to offer acolytes of cool post-punk minimalism who prefer a little anthemic arena rock and musical invention with their explorations of modern sterility. The Boston trio of Roger Miller, Clint Conley, and Peter Prescott brought exuberance and lyricism to their noise rock, producing only one full-length studio album before disbanding in 1983. Producer Martin Swope added the tape effects that lend the band its dreamlike, blurred-around-the-edges sound.

There is broad agreement that moving patient records into the computer age is essential to improving care and curbing costs, but the widespread adoption of this trend is hampered by the challenge of integrating a patient\'s electronic medical record into an individual\'s primary care workflow. A primary care clinician with limited computer experience may struggle to integrate patient information into the EMR (Epic Systems, Verona, WI, USA) even if the clinician is proficient in the use of an electronic medical record system.^[@R1]^ However, clinicians with extensive experience in primary care may find that the task is much easier.

Surgical Strike Day : State Education minister Partha Chatterjee yesterday criticised the central government alleging that the UGC 's direction was 'arbitrary' and 'not well-thought'

Highlights The UGC on Friday directed state education ministers to stop using a particular book

State ministers had used the book since 2009 to train students in history

Surgical Strike Day on Republic Day was to be observed on Thursday

State education ministers were on Tuesday told to stop using a book of history on the 1962 war with China to train students. The Union government has said that a circular had been sent to all state education ministers last week and they need to follow it.

Eighteen years ago Monday , on June 24 , 1995 , South Africa ’ s Springbok rugby team staged a public mutiny during a Test match in Johannesburg , which led to the firing of the coach and the suspension of six players from the squad. The players, led by the flyhalf, Francois Pienaar, demanded a meeting with then President Nelson Mandela , whose birthday it was. Pienaar and five of the other suspended players were cleared by the disciplinary committee. The sixth player , Pieter ” Pacca ” Botha was suspended for a year after being charged with striking with intent.

With the economic noose poised to tighten around Iran over its suspect nuclear program, the Tehran regime is shaking a stick at Gulf nations. Tensions in the Persian Gulf and modest economic recovery in the United States could influence retail gasoline prices, analysts said. The International Energy Agency could respond to a major Middle East oil crisis but doesn't see any immediate need for action, the group's director said. Military officials in Tehran said the United States can not stop Iran from preventing oil from passing through the strategic Strait of Hormuz.

The Brother MFC-J775DW is a low-priced inkjet with very low running costs and a basic feature set for a home-office printer. The printer offers a 4-inch color touchscreen with intuitive navigation, a 4-ink cartridge, and a USB port for sharing. It is compatible with Microsoft Windows 7, Windows 8, and macOS 10.12. For $80, you get a printer, four ink cartridges, and the software to set the machine up. If you are looking for more features and better performance you should consider an alternative such as the Brother MFC-J685DW.

China began three days of national mourning for the victims of the May 12 earthquake , restricting access to entertainment venues, television and radio, and canceling flights at three major airports, state-run media said. The quake, measuring 7.0, hit in the mountainous area near the cities of Tianjin and Beijing, killing nearly 300 people and injuring more than 10,000. The quake was widely felt in central China’s Hubei province, where more than 100,000 homes and buildings collapsed or partially collapsed, according to local reports. In Beijing, at least seven high-rise buildings collapsed during the earthquake, Xinhua said.

I think we understand how the world works, in terms of the social, the political, and the economic. We understand all this, and how the world functions, but how to explain, to somebody else? That's where we have a problem. I think it's impossible, because there's so many things that happen that we don't understand. That's the nature of the human condition; that's what we live with every day.

In the age of Instagram , food is no longer designed to just be food . It ’ s a lifestyle , or it ’ s art. This is evident in many ways, but maybe the most obvious is by the ever-increasing number of brands who’ve transformed the way food is advertised and consumed . Today, there ’ s the ever-popular lifestyle brands, like Chipotle , which aim to make the food more “experimental” and “fun,” rather than the traditional, classic American food that we all grew up with.

French President Emmanuel Macron wants to invigorate the European Union as a global power and spurn the populist nationalism that has defined politics in many of its member states. At a summit meeting in Brussels Friday, he called on European leaders to show that they could build the EU into a truly global player. That’s the opposite of what he said a few months ago when he described Europe as a “failed experiment” in democracy and promised to give up on it. “We need the European Union and the European Union will be even more so in the future,” Macron said in a speech in Brussels.

The University of Arkansas at Fort Smith recently told student Jennifer Braly that she was prohibited from giving lectures about being transgender to classes on campus, despite the fact that faculty were eager to feature her presentations. Braly suspected it was because she had sued the school for other forms of discrimination she faced. This week, the university reversed its policy restricting Braly to gender-neutral bathrooms after the Department of Justice sent a letter on her behalf. Trans students will now be able to use the bathroom corresponding to the gender with which they identify.

Security researchers at Kaspersky Lab say they 've discovered the first virus designed to infect iPods . Called `` Podloso ,`` it's designed to steal users' private information and then sell it on the Internet. The virus has only been observed in iPods sold in the Philippines and Russia and it's only about a month old. It has already infected about 1,600 iPods. If it infects an iPod, the hackers behind it will take control of the iPod and then use it to send spam messages to users' friends or download files from their PCs. But the real point of this attack is financial.

It 's not your imagination—but you should blame the candidates , not the media . The father in question has become such a media celebrity that he 's given us a new verb. If you say that a politician or political party "tweets" like a teenager, it means he or she does something stupid on the Web . This month , the Republican Party , of all people, has fallen prey to the "tweet" habit. Last Sunday , Senator Rick Santorum announced he was suspending his presidential campaign because "the voters have spoken."

The footage comes days after former St. Anthony, Minnesota, police officer Jeronimo Yanez was acquitted for killing Castile. Jeronimo Yanez, the former St. Anthony, Minnesota, police officer who fatally shot Castile in front of his girlfriend and her 4-year-old daughter during a July 2016 traffic stop was also acquitted of dangerous discharge of a firearm. Minnesota Public Radio’s “74 Seconds” recaps former police officer Jeronimo Yanez’s livestreamed killing of Castile at a traffic stop, then delves into his current manslaughter trial. St. Anthony, Minnesota, police officer Jeronimo Yanez fatally shot Castile on July 6.

ORANGEBURG , S.C. — Talk-show host and media mogul Oprah Winfrey has conducted a jailhouse interview with a South Carolina man who said he and a friend murdered a young black man in an apparent hate crime in 2015, in what prosecutors allege was one of several violent attacks against black men by a trio of white men in the small upstate town of Orangeburg. Reed Timmerman, who is black and was arrested in March for the fatal shooting of Walter “Lil Man” Myers, spoke with Winfrey for about 90 minutes this month at the Orangeburg-Calhoun Regional Jail, where both were incarcerated while awaiting trial.

The Toronto real estate market is showing signs of stirring from its deep freeze , with new listings starting to creep up. The average selling price of homes in Toronto has been hovering around the $700,000 mark for the last few weeks. However, the price of new listings are still way down and are not expected to begin to increase until October, according to a report from the Toronto Real Estate Board. The average selling price for Toronto condos is also still hovering in the mid $500,000s. The inventory of homes for sale in Toronto is at a low point.

Carton House: The 668-acre mansion, hotel and golf and sports facilities “reached consensual agreement with Nama to put Carton House Resort on the market” for €60m. One of Ireland’s most prestigious sporting resorts, Carton House Hotel, Spa & Golf Resort, near Maynooth, Co Kildare, goes for sale today on the international market. Joint selling agents Savills and CBRE are guiding €60 million for the 668 acres for sale, including a newly restored 18th-century Palladian mansion, Carton House, as well as a separate five-star hotel and golf and sports facilities, which have traded since 2006.

Johnson prepares to leave key K-12 post at Education Dept . Henry L. Johnson , a major addition to the Obama Administration as its first K-12 secretary, prepares to leave his post after a year in the job. His tenure has been dogged by criticism from Democrats and teachers' unions over Obama's push for increased testing of schools. Johnson, who is leaving on Feb. 1 to take over as principal of a K-12 school in the Boston suburbs, said in an interview last week that he was not surprised by the criticism because the Obama administration has made a "commitment" to increase testing of students.

There were two dividing impulses in Robin Williams 's performances that could , roughly , be called his American and his English side. The first , as a comedian , is almost universally admired. The other , as an actor , is not. Williams 's English side , like that of David Niven and Alec Guinness , had qualities that could never be duplicated or even approached by his American side. They were his idiosyncrasies , and they were his great virtues. He had an unrivaled command of accents, a facility for mimicry , and a deep sense of character.

(CNN) A video released Friday by a Minnesota police officer's defense team shows the aftermath of July 6, 2016, the day that St. Anthony police officer Jeronimo Yanez shot and killed Philando Castile while responding to a reported carjacking. Castile, 32, was pulled over during a traffic stop in the small Minnesota town and the two men began to argue before the officer told him to "get your nose out" of his window.

Promises to replace houses sold off under the Right to Buy scheme look increasingly hollow as the Government slashes council spending. Some £4billion will be spent on replacing housing sold for up to £250,000 under the scheme, according to the local authority spending watchdog. Some councils are cutting their Right to Buy funding, with others freezing it for one or two years. New figures from the Local Government Association show how £3.5billion has been spent replacing council homes already sold off. The LGA is calling for councils to be allowed to spend the cash to replace all the housing.

Judy Watson watched as the California Poppy Reserve was established in the 1970s just five miles from her home . Her family had owned and operated a fruit orchard in San Diego for generations, but after the city’s development took off, her land was not only taken from her family, but also used to develop housing. When I first met Watson I was struck by her determination. “The poppies need my help”, she said simply and with a calmness that surprised me. She’d grown up with them, from an early age going on family trips to see wildflowers in the canyons.

On the Web : For site addresses and a map of the tour , check out www.littlespokanestudios.com . Spokane and Mount Spokane lie to the right, about a mile or so west. There’s a reason why Spokane, like so many of the other “tourist destinations” in the Northwest, is often overlooked by travelers and even some locals. There aren’t any really big sights, but there is so much history here and some of the best hiking in the area. The city has been growing for decades but still has a strong sense of small town.

ROBIN VAN PERSIE may still leave Manchester United this summer , but it wo n't be for Qatari side Lekhwiya FC . Van Persie will not sign a new contract at the club , and his agent has said he is looking to move on . However, the Belgium striker is expected to leave Old Trafford next summer in any event.

Weather Underground on the Weather Channel: Highly gender-normative interactions. The lady sits behind the bar when the men are talking. This week the Weather Channel, mainstay of bored insomniacs and families on vacation in Florida, debuted a new weekday prime-time live show about the weather. Problem is, the show, Weather Underground, is set in what appears to be a 40-year-old storm chaser’s parents’ basement and features highly gender-normative interactions between its slew of male meteorologists and its single female presenter, Sarah Dillingham. Dillingham is working on a master’s degree in atmospheric sciences and appears on-camera during every segment of the two-hour show.

This is the ninth dispatch in a series from Jeff Goodell , who will be investigating the effect of climate change on people, animals and ecosystems throughout the world. Read the other eight dispatches

In this report, Jeffrey Goodell takes a closer look at one of the most contentious issues in climate science: whether climate change is already harming people, and whether humans have contributed to the problem. He found that there is overwhelming evidence of human impacts on the planet. The debate over the effects of climate change has often seemed more about emotion than science.

The police have uncovered Class A drugs after using its powers of stop-and-search in Central Park . Arrests were made on the weekend as the investigation into the trafficking of cocaine and heroin into the park continued. Detectives were working with colleagues in London to track the traffickers, according to The Telegraph. Police say the drugs had been smuggled into London by boat from Amsterdam and had been hidden, according to The Times.

AFC Fylde ’ s match at Torquay United has been postponed following a Friday morning pitch inspection at Plainmoor . After delivering a blockbuster such as Meri Gurriya, writer Radain Shah is on a roll as her story explores polarities in a society with double-standards. Trouble knows no bounds when a lively, emancipated, jeans-clad Uswa (Ramsha Khan) — who has male friends and comes home at all hours because her family gives her the trust and space — succumbs to immense family pressure and marries Hannan (Shehzad Sheikh), born and bred in a conservative family set-up. To top it all he has massive anger issues. Uswa’s abaya-wearing repressive mum-in-law (Asma Abbas) calls the shots in Uswa’s new home.

The proposal that foreign powers acquire land in Africa to stem migration is nothing but 'hipster' colonialism. Last week, Germany's Africa Commissioner Gunter Nooke said that European countries should be allowed to lease land and to build and run cities in Africa as a means of stemming what he views as the unchecked expansion of migration from Africa to Europe. For Nooke, allowing the "free development" of these areas would stimulate African economies and create "growth and prosperity" and therefore, reduce the attractiveness of Europe as a destination for migration. The proposal has elicited mixed reactions.

Pro-business policies and a flourishing venture capital (VC) market have made Singapore an ideal destination for start-ups, but more needs to be done to eradicate a long-standing gender imbalance in the tech industry where women entrepreneurs remain a rare breed. In the Southeast Asian city-state, merely 5 percent of tech start-ups are headed by women, according to the World Economic Forum's "Global Gender Gap Report" released in October 2014.

Tim Hortons and an association representing some of its frustrated franchisees are close to reaching a settlement in two class-action lawsuits over alleged unpaid royalties and service fees. Talks on a potential settlement began in December, according to an application filed by the lawyers involved. The suits allege the chain's franchisees are owed thousands of dollars in royalties and fees that have accumulated in a "back-office" account at a Tim Hortons-owned company. A spokesperson for the company couldn't be reached Tuesday. Lawyer Robert Gordon, who represents the plaintiffs, couldn't immediately say whether a settlement would involve all franchisees.

Parents have found that new technology in schools increases communication with their children and their children’s teachers. Be sure that as a parent, you stay up to date on the evolution of technology in education so that your kids can reap the benefits.

HLAAF—Harvard Latin American Alumni and Friends—launched its Facebook page in March 2013 , hosted its first official alumni reception that September, and started a new alumni newsletter in February 2014 to keep members of the HLAAF community up-to-date on upcoming events. The group has a vibrant social media following with more than 4,000 members on Facebook and 4,500 members on Twitter. In February 2013, HLAAF hosted its first official HLAAF reunion. About 100 alumni and their guests traveled to New York City for two days of reminiscing and reconnecting with other alumni from around the country.

JERUSALEM — The face-off at the security gate outside the Western Wall one Friday this month was familiar : for some Israelis, it looked just like another day in the life of Benjamin Netanyahu, who had been in office for almost 10 years. In his right arm, he held a small child; in his left hand, he held a small bouquet of yellow and white flowers; and on his head was a black baseball cap with the word “Zionist” on the front. Standing before him were a group of young adults, including two men and two women, who were chanting his name.

Johnson prepares to leave key K-12 post at Education Dept. Henry L. Johnson, a major addition to the Department of Education during a spate of leadership changes last year, has resigned his position, effective Dec. 31. The assistant secretary for elementary and secondary education, Mr. Johnson said last week that he intends to return to his native North Carolina, but will consult with the federal department for up to six months after his departure. He outlined his plans in a speech at a conference sponsored by the National Association of State Boards of Education in Alexandria, Va.

Tim Hortons and an association representing some of its frustrated franchisees are close to reaching a settlement in two class-action lawsuits the group filed against the coffee-and-doughnut chain. Tim Hortons and the Great White North Franchisee Association submitted a term sheet signed by their respective legal counsel to justice Edward Morgan at the Ontario Superior Court of Justice Wednesday. “I think both parties, we’ve worked really hard to reach this point and I think that it’s going to be positive for the Tim Hortons brand moving forward and for our guests and for Tim Horton franchisees,” said Mark Walker, the GWNFA’s president.

Facing a mountain of debt and increased competition from online (Amazon) and brick-and-mortar (Wal-Mart) retailers, Toys R Us may be positioning itself for a possible bankruptcy filing, according to CNBC. A new report says the giant toy chain has hired a law firm to help restructure its roughly $400 million in debt. Toys R Us relies heavily on holiday sales to support year-round business, and 2016 proved to be a disappointment for the Wayne, N.J.-based company, and CNBC said those weaknesses carried into the spring with a net loss of $164 million in the first quarter of 2017.

Paul Scruggs had a career-high 24 points, Tyrique Jones added a career-high 20 rebounds and tied his career high with 19 points and the Musketeers held off Evansville 91-85 on Saturday. The 6-foot-11 Hankins and 6-9 Scruggs dominated inside against an Evansville team that didn’t put a player taller than 6-7 on the court. The Musketeers had a whopping 51-22 advantage on the boards. The Mountain Home Lady Bombers held the No. 4 ranked team in Class 5A to five field goals over the entire game in a defensive clinic Friday night at The Hangar. Mountain Home outscored Paragould 17-3 to end the game to take a 30-16 victory over the Lady Rams in 5A-East Conference action, creating a three-way tie for second place in the league. The Lady Bombers shot only 9-of-28 (32 percent) from the field in the game, but the hosts held Paragould to only 5-of-22 (22.7 percent) shooting. The score was tied 13-13 early in the third quarter as points were hard to come by for both teams.

In a story April 30 about MobiIeIron Inc. & apos ; s earnings , The Associated Press reported that the company has filed an amended prospectus to offer $12.2 million . The story said the securities offering would be completed by early May . The story also incorrectly reported the amount of cash that the company had as of its December 31, 2009, quarter. MobiIeIron had $3.63 million cash as of the December 31 quarter , or $1.5 million less than previously disclosed . The company had $4.35 million in cash on hand, or $1 million more than previously reported.

The woman was walking home from the Naylor Road Metro Station about 12:05 a.m. Dec. 3 when she was forced to jump onto the tracks and scramble for safety. She was eventually taken to Children's Hospital for treatment, but her injuries were not severe enough to require a trip to the emergency room. She was not wearing a cell phone and was not carrying her identification or purse with her, police said. The incident was caught on surveillance video by a nearby business, and police said the woman's purse was found soon after the incident.

In a small way , we made history . Last Saturday , an ad hoc group of citizens interested in our democracy and the rule of law came together to form a citizens' commission , modeled after the Warren Commission . It is the first citizens' committee formed to probe the murder of an elected public official. It is the first committee to be composed of members of both major parties , Democrat and Republican . It is the first citizens' committee ever to have representatives from the press , legal experts , medical professionals , and government officials who have not been appointed by the subject of inquiry .

The decision on 15 December 2005 in the case of Jones v Garnett was a victory for the taxpayer and should be a wake-up call to the Treasury and the IASB to start thinking in a more pragmatic way about the way the accounting standards and their application will have to be revised. It is time for the IASB to take another look at how they deal with real companies and not just theoretical ones (which is the way in which Jones has applied their standards). Their current obsession with theoretical perfection will not work in a real world environment.

The GoPro brand is synonymous with the action cameras. Whether you use it daily or occasionally, many of you probably have one model or another sitting around the house. But if you want to be in the good graces of one of the most powerful people on Earth, you might want to do more than just take a picture of him eating your fries . The McDonald 's corporation recently announced a new program for shareholders called "Happy Meal Rewards ."

Abby Kelley has 1,426 students in kindergarten through high school this year and is at maximum enrollment. A new facility, at 6 New Bond St., will be for the high school. The middle school will take over the building it has shared with the high school at 10 New Bond St., and the elementary school will stay where it is, in an adjacent building at 10 New Bond St., according to Abby Kelley Superintendent Robert M. Harrington. The new high school could be ready by August 2009 and will include a 450-seat auditorium and a 425-seat gym, he said.

After a recent update to Adobe's Creative Cloud service, some users have reported having their personal data deleted. The data was apparently deleted without their consent or even a warning. The bug has only affected Mac users who installed the update to Creative Cloud and then logged in using their Adobe accounts. Once the users signed in, Creative Cloud activated a script which deleted the contents of the first folder in their computers root directory. Mac users, who use the data backup service Backblaze, ended up being hit the hardest by the bug.

Technology ’ s continuing onslaught , and employees ’ responses to it , will be central issues for the American workforce in the decades ahead. This issue will continue to affect the U.S. economy , the nature of work , the structure of the workforce , the way companies manage human capital, and the prospects for human capital development. We hope this issue of the Forum will provoke the reader to think about the issue and make it a major focus for the coming year. As we have written often in the last four decades, this is the age of the technological revolution, and it is here to stay.

(CNN) -- France's Michel Desjoyeaux won the Vendee Globe solo round the world yacht race for a record second time on Sunday. Desjoyeaux crosses the line in triumph at Les Sables to win his second Vendee Globe. He crossed the line off Les Sables d'Olonne in a time of 84 days, three hours, nine minutes and eight seconds to smash the race record by over three days and claim a 150,000 euros first prize. Desjoyeaux first won the sailing classic in 2001 and emerged victorious again after an incident-packed race which saw two French competitors dramatically rescued.

Varicella-zoster pneumonia is caused by the varicella-zoster virus, which is usually benign and self-limited with solely skin involvement in children. In neonates, there is 25% mortality for those born to mothers afflicted with varicella within 4 days of delivery or 2 days post-delivery.

ORANGEBURG, S.C. — Talk-show host and media mogul Oprah Winfrey has conducted a jailhouse interview with a South Carolina mother who pleaded guilty to killing her two sons. Winfrey went to the jail in Orangeburg last week where 30-year-old Shaquan Duley is awaiting sentencing. Winfrey interviewed Duley’s family in September 2010, a month after Duley suffocated her 2-year-old and 18-month-old sons, then tried to stage their deaths by driving her car into a river. Prosecutors say she killed the children after being badgered by her mother about being a poor parent. Duley faces 30 years to life in prison when she’s sentenced Friday.

AMD's Ryzen CPUs offer some of the best bang for the buck, but which is best? AMD knocked it out of the park with the first and second generations of its Ryzen CPUs built upon the Zen and Zen+ architecture. It certainly helped wash away the taste of its less-than-stellar Bulldozer chips that launched in 2011. Ryzen provides far better per-core performance, power efficiency, and support for more modern technology. But that makes it harder than ever to decide which one to buy. The Ryzen family is broken into four distinct branches, targeting the entry-level, mainstream, performance, and high-end enthusiast sectors of the market.

A new study for The New York Times reveals that the media pay for the top 200 CEOs is now $14.5 million. This is up 55 in the last year. While any one CEO may be well worth his/her raise, it is a growing political and PR problem for corporate America to be seen as rewarding those at the top, with little consideration for actual performance. For millions of Americans who are unemployed, under employed and being foreclosed on, it seems inconceivable that corporate CEOs can be getting significant raises at a time of such economic hardship.

Q . What was your favorite Christmas gift you got as a kid ? A . `` Man , I was so excited when I opened my presents. All the kids were so excited. There were about six presents . According to a new poll by pro-business policy group the Bay Area Council, 34 percent of Bay Area residents are "likely to move out of the Bay Area in the next few years," or so they say. For the study, conducted online, Oakland-based EMC Research polled 1,000 residents of the region from February 12 through March 9. Citing a variety of gripes familiar to all — housing costs, related cost of living, and traffic issues chief among them — 13 percent said they "strongly agree" and 21 percent said they "somewhat agree" that they'll move.

Some restaurateurs are altering menus to accommodate dieters on macro diets. When Chicago-native Vince Schiano was working toward his goal to drop body fat, he’d often carry around a food scale, protein powder and a tupperware full of ground beef or turkey. Vince Schiano started macro dieting in 2016 to lose fat. The diet is different for each person. For example, an active 130-pound adult following a 1,600-calorie diet could opt for 40% of calories from carbs; 30% from protein; and 30% from fat, Runners World recommends.

An injury at work left a husband and father facing a layoff . He could n't return to the job he loved until he took his wife's advice: "Get a job on the Internet." "The job I wanted was impossible," he said recently. "It didn't happen that way. This job is perfect. I love my boss.

Minister for Enterprise and Commerce , Max Bradford , today rejected claims by the Engineers Union that jobs created by the proposed $6 billion East West Link are 'dead' and said there is 'still a lot of work to be done in the east of Melbourne' following the union's decision to support the State Labor Government. The State Government has been heavily criticised by unions and the business sector for its lack of planning over the East West Link, particularly over the number of jobs that will be created as part of the deal between the State Government and Macquarie Group.

The Volstead Act was repealed on this date in 1933 , returning control of alcohol to the states , and the United States was once more a temperance nation

The American Temperance movement , which was in its heyday between the 1820’s to 1920’s , was an effort to make the United States temperance nation , and to keep the nation alcohol free . The movement’s leaders worked to eliminate the sale of intoxicating beverages , promote the drinking water , and encourage temperance for all . They were not against all people who drank alcohol .

DUTA has been boycotting the evaluation for a month now to protest the new faculty reservation mechanism in universities and a host of other issues. New Delhi: The Delhi University Teachers' Association (DUTA) will continue with its evaluation boycott, it said today, even as the university again appealed to them to return to evaluation work. DUTA has been boycotting the evaluation for a month now to protest the new faculty reservation mechanism in universities and a host of other issues. In a General Body Meeting, the DUTA decided to continue its evaluation boycott by adopting a resolution, the teachers' body said.

A truck slammed into a fire hydrant on Western Avenue in San Pedro on Thursday morning , creating a geyser of water, sending people scurrying for cover and sending police scrambling to investigate the scene. One person suffered minor cuts to his face, police said, adding that the driver didn’t stop after the crash. The truck was being towed away from the scene and the driver is cooperating with investigators, according to Sgt. J.D. Nelson. The crash was reported about 10:20 a.m. at Western Avenue and 11th Street. The street was closed in both directions until 11:40 a.m.

In December 2013, INSYS received a subpoena from the Office of Inspector General (OIG) of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), which notified the company of the commencement of an investigation by the DOJ’s Civil Division into the company’s sales and commercial practices and resulted in the company’s corresponding public disclosure. As is often the case, this four-and-a-half-year investigation has been conducted in concert with certain whistleblower litigation that was filed under seal prior to and during the course of the DOJ’s investigation.

Syrian sources said April 14 that the Jordanian charge d'affaires in Lebanon, Hisham Moheisen, who was kidnapped from his residence Feb. 6, had been released in the Lebanese resort town of Shtoura. Monitor Mideast correspondent John Yemma reports that there was no immediate Western or Jordanian confirmation of this development. But several Lebanese media sources reported that Mr. Moheisen had been found -- one saying he was picked up by the Syrian Arab Deterrent Force near the besieged town of Zahle. Jordan has blamed Syria for the abduction. The two countries have had severely strained relations for almost six months and nearly went to war late last year.

Two tech executives played the role of superhero Thursday morning when they thwarted a man's alleged attempt to steal a drone and a remote-control helicopter from a San Francisco Radio Shack. According to CBS San Francisco, a man allegedly entered the Polk Street store at around 10 a.m., grabbed the drone and helicopter, then ran out. Greg Forrest, president and CEO of software company Greenhawk Financial Services, was in the store at the time. He reportedly chased the thief out of the store and engaged him in a fist fight. "Punches and pushing and everything else," Forrest said to CBS.

BOB Cole died yesterday. Around 2pm in a purpose-built flat on a Swiss industrial estate outside Zurich, he said goodbye to his friends, and went to sleep for the last time. He was 68, terminally ill, and was taking his life into his own hands, as around 30 Britons do each year at the Dignitas. His wife, Pam, was one of them. She was suffering from progressive supernuclear palsy, a fatal brain disease, and faced a terrible death. In February last year she died as Chris de Burgh’s Here is Your Paradise played at her bedside.

Even as its board expresses interest in building a branch museum downtown (see "City for challenges. "), the National World War II Aviation Museum has big plans for its current Colorado Springs Airport spot. According to its website, the museum plans to build a new 72,000 square-foot aircraft display hangar and an 86,000 square-foot building to house new exhibit galleries, an events center, and a state-of-the-art education facility. The museum has received a $1 million grant from the Slattery Family Foundation to fund design of the project, which will be built by GE Johnson Construction and designed by CSNA Architects.

At least 21 people were killed and hundreds wounded in four days of fighting between two rival tribes in the southern Libyan town of Sebha. The clashes are between the Awled Suleiman tribe and the tribe of deposed leader Muammar Gaddafi, the Guedadfa tribe. The death toll is at 21 and about one hundred wounded from the Awled Suleiman tribe, according to the head of the Sebha Medical Center, Nasser al-Jehimi. The number of wounded victims on the part of the Guedadfa tribe is not known as they are being treated in another hospital.

(Reuters) - British serviced office space provider IWG Plc said on Wednesday it would close or refurbish some locations in certain markets, including the UK, to bring its performance back on track after reporting a lower full-year operating profit. The Switzerland-based company behind the Regus and Spaces brand said it was looking to revive its UK operations, which has been hit by a weak property market in London and higher costs related to opening of new sites. The company, which had warned on profit in June, reported a 5.6 percent fall in full-year operating profit to 154.1 million pounds.

The husband of a woman suspected of cutting a fetus out of another woman told police he found the baby in a bag in their bathroom after his wife told him that she had gone to a bar, according to a report from the Los Angeles Times. The baby is believed to have died in utero. The couple, who have been married for 12 years, discovered the dead fetus on the bathroom floor. She told him she went out drinking and “lost her head” at a bar, the paper reported.

The word hero gets thrown around so much that its use has lost much of the intended impact. Indie filmmaker Denise Ohio restores a bit of the word’s luster with this surprisingly compelling portrait of Frank Minden. Who? An ordinary, hard-working man, a WWII vet and master diesel machinist, the 76-year-old Minden has never signed a multimillion-dollar contract with a sports franchise or refused an Oscar in honor of the worthy cause of the day. But in the short space of thirty minutes, Ohio illustrates what makes this St. Louis man so admired and respected by those around him.

New Delhi : The ruling Communist Party of India ( Marxist ) , or CPM , is prepared for a confrontation with the BJP in Kerala if the state goes to polls in the fourth week of the ongoing panchayat election. It has deployed all its forces to the hilt to mobilise votes, including in the districts of Kollam, Kannur , Kasaragod , Kozhikode , Pathanamthitta and Kasargod , the CPM said. The party’s strategy, as the CPM leader told The Wire , has been to use the election as a referendum on the government’s performance in Kerala, with a focus on development and law and order.

That’s not because they didn’t know the words, but because the crowd didn’t care about those words. Sanday , a Scottish island inhabited by only six people , has just got its first road – an unpaved track – that leads from its pier to the tiny village of Dunnet Head and the surrounding coast. But the first road on a Scottish island isn't something to celebrate, it’s something to be wary of …

The whole of Sanday is one big expanse of peat. It’s the highest island in the United Kingdom, is covered in moorland, has a handful of low-lying houses on its western flank, a handful on the southern coast and then nothing for thousands of square miles.

Shimla , Jan 14 ( IANS ) It was a bright sunny day in Himachal Pradesh on Monday , with the coldest temperature of 15 degrees Celsius recorded at Chamba and the hottest of 49 degrees Celsius at Keylong . In Shimla on January 14, however, the mercury hovered around 25 degrees Celsius with intermittent light rains . The Met Office had predicted rain in the region on Sunday but its prediction proved to be true. “On Monday, the maximum temperatures will stay around the freezing point,” said Met director B.K. Meena .

An Austrian man has nearly burned down his home in an attempt to get rid of a mouse . The fire has left him with serious injuries, including a partially amputated leg. A fire has ripped through a house belonging to an Austrian homeowner who nearly burned down his home after attempting to burn a mouse to death. A fire at a home in Austria nearly destroyed the house on Saturday. Fortunately, the fire was quickly extinguished by a neighbor, and only one person was slightly injured. The fire started when the homeowner, named only as Hans, attempted to burn a mouse alive, the BBC reports.

The patient is a college student who studies in a university in an urban area. The patient had no medical or drug exposure in the past. What will happen to a living organism placed in a state of quantum superposition ? September 22 , 2015 , 0 comments

Let us say I am a cat in a superposition of being alive and dead in two quantum states. In my case the quantum state representing me is entangled with the quantum states representing my two friends, Alice and Bob. Let us also say that Alice and Bob each hold in their hands a quantum state entangled with my state. When I am alive my state of being is entangled with Alice and Bob's states.

Best Buy Co. Inc. shares surged 9% in premarket trade after the electronics retailer's fiscal third-quarter profit and revenue sailed past estimates. Best Buy said it had net income of $107 million, or 30 cents a share, in the quarter, up from $54 million, or 12 cents a share, in the year-earlier period. Adjusted per-share earnings came to 32 cents, well ahead of the 25 cents estimate from analysts polled by FactSet. Revenue rose to $9.38 billion from $9.33 billion, also ahead of the FactSet estimate of $9.11 billion.

Teaching language to an artificial intelligence system is child’s play, thanks to MIT. Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology developed a parser that imitates kids’ learning processes by observing the environment and making connections. The system studies captioned videos and learns to associate words with objects and actions. When given a new sentence, the parser can accurately predict its meaning—without visual clues. This “weakly supervised” approach, which requires limited training input, could expand the types of data and reduce the effort needed for training parsers. Annotations can certainly speed up the process, but they’re not needed to learn.

The future leadership of Volkswagen hangs in the balance today as the 20-member board of the troubled and iconic company meets to decide critical issues including who the next CEO will be in the wake of Martin Winterkorn‘s resignation earlier this week and how deep the cuts must go into the ranks of executives held responsible — along with the action plan to win back the trust of shocked customers and government regulators. Meanwhile, other top-level action continues as European regulators begin delving into VW’s emissions behaviors and as 27 state attorneys general in the United States develop a potential criminal case against the German automaker.

Even as its board expresses interest in building a branch museum downtown ( see `` City for challenges . `` ), the Los Angeles Conservancy has just unveiled a major expansion, a $9.1-million expansion that will create an entirely new wing on the back side of its West Hollywood campus. With a new building that will include a major new gallery, the expansion will be the largest single investment in the Conservancy's 60 years, and it will double the number of art and history exhibitions in West Hollywood, where the museum has its home.

The first image of Earth from lunar orbit . Before an Apollo-era NASA could launch a few humans on top-secret missions to the Moon, it had to figure out how to actually get a few men off the planet. Here's what that meant... It's a picture so breathtakingly beautiful and breathtakingly weird, that it has inspired many a poem and song. It is a picture of Earth as seen from Moon orbit on the night of March 17, 1969. The Moon was at perigee — its furthest north of orbit.

HLAAF—Harvard Latin American Alumni and Friends—launched its Facebook page in March 2013, hosted its first official alumni reception that May, launched its official website (www.harvardlatinamerica.org) this past June, and in October helped sponsor the first Latin America Career Fair at Harvard. That event—run by HLAAF, the Office of Career Services, the David Rockefeller Center for Latin American Studies, and the Harvard-affiliated Academic and Professional Programs for the Americas (LASPAU)—drew 120 undergraduate and graduate students, as well as LASPAU fellows and a mix of employers ranging from U.S. and Latin-American companies to nonprofit groups, reports HLAAF president María Carla Chicuen ’10.

For Bruce Logan , microbes are an electrifying subject . The Kappe professor of environmental engineering at Pennsylvania State University , Logan works with microbiologists around the globe on projects that range from understanding how microbes live and reproduce to discovering how to control the growth and health of plants. In recent years, his team has studied how biofilms, the masses of single-celled organisms that colonize our bodies, interact with electricity. His work shows that biofilms use electric currents to navigate and migrate. In addition to his studies, Logan runs the Microbial Electrochemical Technology Group in his laboratory, which he founded in 2010.

Jill McGown, who has died aged 59 from cancer, was one of the generation of crime writers who shifted the genre firmly into the contemporary world. Although she held fast to the traditional skill of well-crafted plots, she brought a modern perspective to characters and situations, creating a series of thoughtful and engaging police procedurals. She will be best remembered for the 13 novels featuring Chief Inspector Danny Lloyd and Sergeant Judy Hill. Theirs was a relationship that encompassed the personal as well as the professional, and Jill's deft handling of its development was one of the keynote elements of the books.

If you live along the Eastern Seaboard and wake up early Friday you could be treated to a colorful sky. A high-altitude geostationary satellite called NIKI is set to pass through the atmosphere over the Atlantic Ocean, and at its closest approach, its solar array will be fully exposed to the sun. As a result, the satellite's orbit will slowly shift northward. If you're lucky enough to be able to spot the passing satellite from the East Coast, it will be a spectacular sight with the sun gleaming off its solar panels.

With all the charm of yesterday with many of today 's modern features , this lovely 3 bedroom craftsman cottage is just waiting to greet you. This delightful home is an easy 5 minute drive to the village centre , where you can find everything you need , and you will find yourself back here frequently as there are plenty of restaurants , pubs and coffee shops within walking distance.

Some Zimbabwe government supporters say President Robert Mugabe should form a government without the opposition, following an opposition boycott of talks Monday in Swaziland. Tendai Maphosa asked ordinary Zimbabweans in Harare what they think about this latest threat to the power-sharing deal signed last month and reports for VOA. After failing to agree on the allocation of Cabinet posts last week, Zimbabwe's ruling ZANU-PF party and the opposition Movement for Democratic Change decided to refer the matter to the Southern African Development Community. They agreed to meet with SADC representatives earlier this week, but that meeting never took place.

Judy Watson watched as the California Poppy Reserve was established in the 1970s just five miles from her home. She was looking forward to cherishing its vistas forever. But today Watson is among area residents and nature lovers who fear that the state park's annual blaze of orange blossoms will be overshadowed by "green" — energy, that is, in the form of sprawling solar panels and gigantic industrial-size wind turbines. "The whole area will be changed forever," said Watson, 70, who lives in Kings Canyon at the base of verdant Portal Ridge.

American troops may have finally left Iraq , but for that nation 's citizens the war is only getting worse and the violence will continue in their home city of Ramadi .
