Cryptocurrencies, outside of Bitcoin, have failed to garner much attention from buyers, and while the same can be said of sellers, the digestion of losses over the past month is likely to lead to more losses soon. Ethereum, Ripple, and Litecoin are all carving out a similar bear-flag pattern that should lead to another purge of speculative excesses. Weak price action in ETH/USD has it set up to make another leg lower soon. It could continue to drift ever-so-slightly higher, but the developing bear-flag implies risk is skewed more heavily towards the downside.

Ontario’s Special Investigations Unit has ended its investigation into the death of a 43-year-old Rideau Lakes man who allegedly shot himself after receiving a phone call from police. The incident occurred on the afternoon of June 3, in the Township of Rideau Lakes, just west of Smiths Falls, when an Ontario Provincial Police officer contacted the man and told him he would be arrested. Shortly afterward, at 3:20 p.m., the man called 911 reporting that he had sustained a self-inflicted gunshot wound. Police and paramedics responded to the call and the man was taken to Ottawa Civic Hospital by air ambulance.

Running errands on your bicycle is a great way to burn calories and get some exercise . When you need to travel a lot, a bicycle is a handy way to get where you want to go. If you want to save money on gas, it makes sense to drive a bicycle when you can. It is also possible to take a bicycle on trains, and some trains in the USA have bike racks in front of the passenger car. In general, bikes are allowed on all types of public transportation in Europe.

TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan on Wednesday basked in the glow of its World Cup soccer team’s historic win over Colombia, a victory that has lifted the nation’s mood after an earthquake struck its second-biggest metropolis Osaka. Fans watching Tuesday night’s match at pubs and outdoor bars in the downtown Tokyo area of Shibuya celebrated when Japan clinched a 2-1 victory, exchanging high-fives with strangers on the street and flooding into Shibuya’s famous “scramble crossing,” prompting scores of police to come out to ensure order.

Chipolo Plus is supposedly the loudest Bluetooth item tracker available today , and its chirpy tune can be heard from over 30 metres away. The fact that we could hear the device being played over our sound system didn’t trouble us much, but the fact that we could clearly see it as it passed by our office entrance did. At $129.99 this isn’t cheap, but its performance merits the price tag (see our review). It’s very simple to pair a device like this, and we had no issues with that.

Pliskova pulls out of Czech team for Fed Cup final vs. U.S. PRAGUE ( Reuters ) - World number eight Simona Halep's dream run at the Baku Cup came to an end on Friday with a shock 2-6, 6-3, 6-1 defeat by Czech number one Karolina Pliskova in the final in Baku. Halep, the current Wimbledon champion, looked set to become the third Romanian player to win two WTA singles titles after Alexandra Dulgheru did so in 1998 and Anca Master in 2007 but, after winning the first set, went on to fall apart in the second, third and fourth.

An Austrian man has nearly burned down his home in an attempt to get rid of a mouse. The man found a mouse hole in his newly renovated house in Austria. In order to rid of the unwanted guest, the man filled the wall with flammable polyurethane foam. According to news website ORF.at, when the home owner started to pulverize the foam, it caught fire from a candle. As a result, an entire wall of the house started to burn, leading to a massive fire. It took 32 firefighters to extinguish the blaze.

New York/London: Volatility returned to US markets, with stocks tumbling back toward a bear market after the biggest rally in nearly a decade evaporates. The dollar gave up some of the previous session’s advances. Oil slipped below $46 a barrel. The S&P 500 sank more than 2.4%, unable to add to a 5% surge that was the biggest since March 2009. Technology and consumer shares that led the gain were among the biggest decliners Thursday. The Dow Jones Industrial Average lost more than 500 points, after its first 1,000 point gain.

Who pulled the plug on the canal this time ? It ’ s winter , and we ’ re certainly going to see fewer visitors and fewer boats. A: That ’ s what we ’ ve been hoping for, and it ’ s looking that way , but we ’ ll just have to keep working through this cold season until the ice is ready. We ’ ll try to keep the canal ice at the right thickness until spring, then we ’ ll have a good, warm summer and hopefully see an increase in visitors and activity.

Bavarian farmers are angry that their famous Alpine dairy cows will apparently have to wear nappies under European Union environmental rules. This is the first time that cows have had to be fitted with special underwear to avoid upsetting the delicate ecosystem on which the animals feed. If the regulation goes ahead as it is expected to, farmers could be faced with a 40 euro a day per cow cost, which would be a real burden for many small farms. The regulation could also affect the Alpine region's reputation as an important milk producing region for the EU, the biggest producer of dairy products in the region.

HIGH POINT, N.C. — A dentist lost her license after two patients died, according to a Final Agency Decision report from the North Carolina Board of Dental Examiners. Shawana Neopi Patterson, who was first licensed in 2011, was an oral and maxillofacial surgeon at her practice Patterson Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery in High Point. In one instance, the report found that Patterson took little action when one patient turned "bluish-gray," and only called EMS for a second patient once she had no pulse. The report revealed two cases in which patients provided medical histories that indicated they should have only undergone surgery under emergencies.

It seems that we may have some new details coming out of the Luann De Lesseps camp after she was just released from her last jail sentence. This time, Luann was released from jail on October 30, 2012 after serving time for her third contempt of court. It was reported at the time that she spent 24 hours behind bars for that one.

Some TOPS members are part of other weight-loss groups at the YMCA . MANSFIELD - A group of teenagers were treated at the University of Vermont's medical center on Thursday after their vehicle was hit by another car during a race to the hospital . The accident occurred around 3:30 p.m. at Route 30A and Route 102 in MANSFIELD . One of the injured teens suffered severe head injuries.The other five were treated and released, according to the Vermont State Police.No one else was hurt in the wreck. The injured teen is a Mansfield High School graduate, according to police .

This week , in a closed-door meeting of Congressional Democrats with President Obama , Representative Ed Perlmutter of Colorado bluntly told the president that he and a group of colleagues have decided not to run for re-election in 2018 — a decision they say they reached after “months” of conversations with family members about whether they should run for a third term. Mr. Perlmutter, who served as chairman of the House Appropriations Committee in the last Congress, was the fourth Democrat with presidential ambitions in Colorado to drop out. Rep. Jared Polis, a freshman member of Congress, has already launched his bid for the nomination.

The police have uncovered Class A drugs after using its powers of stop-and-search in Central Park. Arrests were made as Cambridgeshire police responded to complaints of anti-social behaviour in Park Ward, with particular emphasis on the park. Police Sergeant Warren Bottell said: “In November and December we conducted two periods of intensive patrolling in the Central Park area. We had different results with significantly more drug users stopped and arrested. In total, 12 full days of patrols since November 2015 have been conducted in the Central Park area, with stop-and-searches carried out between February 9 and 12.

Made of Q-Tips, this craft goes far beyond a miniature garland or cake topper. The light strand also looks cute as a bracelet, necklace, package decoration, or decoration for a miniature Christmas tree or dollhouse. Set up an area to work in, on top of a piece of waxed paper. Place a little bit of each paint color in its own bottle cap or other small container. One by one, dip the ends of the Q-tips in the paint. To avoid drips, scrape the end of the Q-tip on the edge of the bottle cap.

Normal results: a letter will be sent to the family. To protect the privacy of your medical information, we may request an authorization form before disclosing your personal health information.

Swedish furnishing giant IKEA is still looking to build a new store in Coventry which could create around 600 jobs. The firm has submitted plans to open a store at the Coventry Centre shopping centre on Coventry Road which would take around 100,000sqft and create 600 jobs at full build cost. However the plans were given the go-ahead by Coventry council in October and have yet to be confirmed at a national level, with the firm still awaiting the final decision on the site. But with Coventry council currently in administration there is a risk the plans could be cancelled at the end of the year.

Tacko Fall, who stands 7’5″, is unstoppable. Likely the tallest player in high school basketball, he’s always turning heads in the gym. “Everywhere I go, people want to take pictures, talk to me, shake my hand, but I’m getting used to it now,” the Tavares (Fla.) Liberty Christian Prep junior told the Orlando Sentinel last year. Fall arrived in Florida from Dakar, Senegal with little to no organized basketball experience. He has also lived in Texas, Ohio and Tennessee.

PASSENGERS are now banned from drinking alcohol purchased from duty free shops under new rules . It 's hoped that the new ban will have the same impact on the UK's crime rate as sniffer dog searches at airports . The rules were signed into effect on November 1st, and will apply to all shops at UK's airports, except airports in the Republic of Ireland , and at Channel ports. The new rules apply at all times except the hours between 12am and 8am on Sunday and the hours between 7pm and 9pm on Saturday night.

My research aims to improve our understanding of how cells with the same genome can develop dramatically different behaviors. For example, consider the mechanical abilities of a muscle cell compared to the electrical excitability of a neuron, or the industrious activity of bone building cells in a youthful person compared to an elderly one. Each of these cells, (if taken from the same individual) has an identical genome — and yet each is “reading” a very distinct subset of that genome and consequently carrying out very different behaviors. The choice of what to read and what to hide away is made during development.

Slack said the deal is part of its continued efforts to make the collaboration hub more flexible beyond engineering and development, by adding more communication and collaboration tools for users. "By combining these technologies and expanding the range of apps available to all Slack users in a way that is truly accessible for everyone, it's clear that this is something we have always wanted to do," he said in a statement.

An extra $ 190,000 in state special education reimbursement funding that came in late last month has helped the town continue to fund special needs services in schools. With $1.3 million in state and federal funding now available to pay for special ed services in school districts with less than 90% of students eligible for free/reduced priced lunch, the state is allowing districts to use funding for additional special education students. Town meeting is next week

Town meeting is set for Tuesday. Voters will have a chance to discuss proposed amendments to the state budget.

Big Data is transforming the way Canadian businesses are able to build meaningful relationships with their customers. Today the Chief Information Officer and Chief Marketing Officer must combine efforts for true competitive advantage. A new market research report called "1 + 1 = 3: CMO & CIO Collaboration Best Practices That Drive Growth" looks at the new realities that are changing traditional roles of marketing and information technology. This report addresses how organizations are aligning their efforts to better understand and interact digitally with their customers and drive loyalty. According to studies by the Conference Board of Canada, Canadian organizations appear to be lagging behind the consumers.

A truck slammed into a fire hydrant on Western Avenue in San Pedro on Thursday morning, creating a geyser and backing up traffic on the busy thoroughfare. Lomita sheriff’s Lt. Tony Del Pinto said the agency received a call at about 10:45 a.m. that a green truck had collided with the hydrant near the intersection of Western and Delasonde Drive near the Garden Village Shopping Center. It’s not clear if the driver was injured in the crash. Cal Water crews shut off water to nearby businesses for about five minutes, Kingman said, as it was working to restore service.

Now he's set to become the heir to one of the most influential kings in history - the Roman emperor Augustus. The PS4 is launching with a versatile set of games today, but that doesn’t mean Sony wants gamers to focus on them. Mere minutes before the console’s launch, Sony took to a stage in New York City to reveal more exclusive experiences for its gaming console. The company started its launch event with news for fans of the The Last of Us adventure game starring Ellen Page. Sony’s studios are already working on a single-player campaign add-on for the game, and if the trailer is any indication, there are still more battles to fight and more mysteries to uncover.

Low-income working families are losing hundreds of pounds each year – and being wrongly denied free healthcare entitlements – because of flaws in the way universal credit is designed, campaigners say. The Child Poverty Action Group (CPAG ) said arbitrary rules built in to the way universal credit is calculated leave some families unable to predict how much they will be paid each month, leaving households in debt and unable to budget. It can lead to claimants being wrongly benefit-capped – a penalty designed to “incentivise” jobless or low-earning households by severely limiting their benefits – because the system fails to spot they are working and earning enough.

Timeshares are luxury alternatives for your annual vacation. Instead of staying at a hotel, you purchase your own vacation home valid for a specific time frame each year. When you purchase a deeded timeshare, you get property rights to the unit.

AUSTIN — Rep. Rafael Anchia filed a resolution Monday condemning President Donald Trump's executive order restricting travel to the United States for citizens of seven Muslim-majority countries. Anchia, a Democrat from Dallas, described the move as "unconstitutional, un-American, unwise and unorganized." "This was not well thought out," Anchia said. "It was developed without consultation of the folks that are supposed to keep us safe, and the president really messed this up, and he needs to pull it down. The Legislature of the state of Texas needs to demand that he do so."

Angela Mahoney , 52 , of Bentley , scooped �75,000 on the Irish Lottery and could now win another million by winning the European Powerball jackpot. But this time she could end up with �1.5 million, rather than �750,000, after the European Lottery has matched her win. But before she begins to dream of all that cash, she must first pay a �15,000 first instalment of the prize � and her solicitor said she must pay another �300,000 to buy a house in Co Meath , where she can stay with her two sons.

The U.S. government is charging that Google is systematically paying women less than their male counterparts. Testifying in a San Francisco court Friday, Department of Labor (DOL) regional director Janette Wipper said the government “found systemic compensation disparities against women pretty much across the entire workforce,” according to a report in The Guardian. The charges come as part of a lawsuit the DOL filed against Google in January, seeking access to the company’s compensation data and related personnel records. As a federal contractor, Google is required to permit the government to inspect records relevant to its compliance with equal opportunity laws.

A 29-year-old woman was killed when her car was hit by a train on a crossing in Ogi, Saga Prefecture, police said Sunday. According to police, the incident occurred at around 5:50 p.m. Saturday on a crossing on the JR Nagasaki Line near Kubota Station. Fuji TV reported that the driver of the car, Miki Fukuzaki, was taken to hospital with extensive injuries but died about two hours later. Police quoted the driver of the train as saying he saw the car on the crossing and applied the emergency brake but couldn’t stop in time.

The Jawbone Up debuted last year with big ambitions : A bracelet-like device that you 'd wear all the time, measuring your activity and sleep, and letting you control your smart home from your wrist. Unfortunately, Jawbone has been silent about the Up since then and we've heard precious little of the device, even as competitors like Xiaomi and Nest have been teasing theirs. But now we finally know when it will be available, as it's coming to AT&T in the United States. The AT&T-exclusive version is being called the "Verse," and will launch on May 14th, 2016.

Iqbal Survé ’ s Sagarmatha Technologies , which failed to list on the JSE a year ago , has set a target of listing on AIM by the second half of 2017, which it expects to lead to a substantial improvement in the share price. The group also plans to double its headcount within the next year to about 700 people, Mr. Survé says. It is currently around 200 employees. “We have always seen it as the primary way to grow the business and create value. We want to make a significant number of acquisitions, which we expect to accelerate in the next few years.

A cartographer that created maps for senior policy makers at the National Counterterrorism Center wants to map out your next hunt or backpacking trip. Ben Harshyne and his wife Kate Harshyne took a risk this year when Ben left his job as a contractor where he made maps for the National Counterterrorism Center and chose to work full time on a company he started called HUNTERRA Mapping. HUNTERRA creates maps by blending high-resolution aerial photography with a 3D-like terrain model. The company can create waterproof, tear resistant field maps, poster maps and custom-sized mega maps.

Akshara Haasan had what you would call a dream debut in Bollywood with ‘ Shamitabh ’ . The actor is currently in the US for ‘ Bharata ’, and the film will release on January 18 .

If you live along the Eastern Seaboard and wake up early Friday you could be treated to a colorful sky hours before sunrise lights up the horizon. The Terrier-Improved Malumute sounding rocket is scheduled for launch Friday between 4:26 a.m. and 4:41 a.m. ET. Sounding rockets, by the way, have been used for over 40 years to carry science payloads on brief, 5-20 minute missions to space. Friday morning should provide mostly clear skies in the viewing location, and upper level winds should be friendly enough to allow the launch to take place (if not, backup launch dates are available each morning through June 6).

Now is the right time to prepare for the bushfire season in Tasmania . Prepare your property and make a list of things you would need in a fire . ( CNN ) — Portuguese sailors called it the `` Gates of Hell . '' Namibia 's Bushmen speak of it as the `` Road of Death . '' Its name means `` white man 's grave , '' but its real name, if one could ever find out, is probably something like `` the road to oblivion . '' On April 3, the International Whaling Commission will meet to consider whether to lift its moratorium on the hunt of the finback, minke, sei and blue whales. These animals are the subject of intense conservation efforts by animal welfare organizations like the Humane Society of the U.S.

You may remember Gary Coleman, the child actor from the 1970s show "Diff'rent Strokes." Coleman died on May 28, 2010, in Provo, Utah, from an intracranial hemorrhage. There is much that can be learned from Coleman's less-than-perfect estate plan. However, to understand where Coleman went wrong, some context is needed. Coleman, like many child actors, had a very sad and tragic life. After "Diff'rent Strokes" ended its successful eight year run, Coleman sued his parents for misappropriating millions of dollars in his trust fund.

Media & Entertainment I write about women in the business of Hollywood . New research released today from the Geena Davis Institute reveals that women are still vastly under-represented in the entertainment business. Women are not only under-represented at the top, but throughout the entire industry, from the highest levels of decision making to the bottom of the pyramid. This new report is a must-read for any aspiring female entrepreneur or those who just want more women at the table. I wrote a piece in 2012 for Forbes about why you should consider launching your own media company.

The Texas Supreme Court has transferred about 80 cases from El Paso's 8th Court of Appeals in a first of its kind move to reduce a growing backlog. AUSTIN — In an unprecedented move, the Texas Supreme Court has stripped more than 80 cases from the 8th Court of Appeals in El Paso due to the court's growing backlog. The cases, some of which are up to 3 years old, are being transferred to other appeals courts in Texas. Most are at the final stage of processing, awaiting a decision from the three justices on El Paso's court.

This pill is blue, and is supposed to be a pain reliever. What is this? Is it blue? It looks blue, but it may be green... It looks blue and blue. I think it's blue. All the pills are blue so this pill must be green. Green is the answer. Blue.

Under construction at 664 North Michigan Avenue , the former site of the Terra Museum of American Art , The Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago announced that it will build its first permanent museum at the site in the coming year. The museum, to be called MCA Chicago, is scheduled to be completed in time for the 2015 Biennial in June 2015 . It is being built as a $300 million museum complex on a lot that includes the building's current exhibition space, a 10th floor terrace, and the parking garage. It is designed by Pelli Clarke Pelli , with interiors designed by Kohn Pederson Fox .

One 15-year-old girl from Russia loved sharing her image on social media. She would take selfies whenever the mood struck her, which was often, and then share them via her phone with her friends, followers, and the world at large. But Karina Baymukhambetova was killed when she stepped in front of a speeding train in Orsk to get the best selfie of her life. Moments after she told her relative to “be afraid of nothing in life,” the train slammed into the teenager and left her body “cut to pieces” in the devastating aftermath.

Two years ago , Red Sox prospect Ryan Westmoreland seemed to be on the fast track to the majors . But he tore his elbow ligament while in the midst of spring training , and has been rehabbing for the better part of the season . He is still working his way back , but he did recently make a cameo appearance with the PawSox , going 0 for 5 . But it seems as though the big-leaguers are ready to look past him and give Westmoreland's future to another young player who is on an equally quick track .

Testimony began Monday in Carrie Lea Reynolds ' trial . She is charged with second-degree murder in the death of her infant son, Isaiah . On Monday, prosecutors asked the jury of seven women and four men to rely on the testimony of expert witnesses to convict . The jury was instructed to convict Reynolds if it found her guilty beyond a reasonable doubt. As the trial got underway , Reynolds sat quietly in the back of the courtroom, her hands folded across her chest. She wore an orange prison jumpsuit and handcuffs, and her short hair had been dyed blond, but she did not wear glasses.

SUT-PJ/CJ series tuner modules TOKYO—Sony Corp. announced commercialization of a demodulator and tuner set for 4K- and 8K-capable satellite TV broadcasting receivers. The SUT-PJ1/2 and SUT-PJ2/1 demodulator sets are available for use in both 4K and 8K broadcasts and will be commercially available this year for the first time in the country. The demodulators are designed for use with Panasonic's 8K and 4K broadcast receivers and Sony's latest 4K broadcast receiver, the XDCAM-AXR100 and AXR200. (AXR stands for Advanced X-Series Receiver.) With the demodulator, broadcasters can transmit a signal with a higher-resolution 4K- or 8K-capable TV receiver.

The ex-girlfriend of the football star whose plane disappeared has spoken out — making a sensational claim about who is behind the crash. Argentine football player Emiliano Sala's light aircraft has gone missing over the English Channel. He had recently signed for premier league team Cardiff City from French team Nantes. Emiliano Sala’s model ex-girlfriend is claiming that the “football mafia” is behind the doomed plane crash in the Channel. Berenice Schkair, 27, said her “heart is broken” and she is “destroyed” after hearing the plane her former partner was on vanished on its way to Cardiff.

Why do we only hear about Jasper Johns when he gets ripped off? Jasper Johns is the greatest artist alive. It seems a shame that he only enters the headlines when people rip him off. Johns was in court this week to give evidence against a Queens, New York foundry owner, Brian Ramnarine, who has now pleaded guilty to faking one of the artist's works. It was a bronze version of one of the most iconic of all American paintings: Flag. Johns had made four bronze copies of Flag in 1960 at Ramnarine's foundry.

NSA Director General Keith Alexander maintains that his agency's tactics are lawful and used against foreign adversaries. The National Security Agency is using the tracking data intended for Google's advertisers to locate its targets. According to the Washington Post's new analysis of an internal presentation Edward Snowden leaked earlier in the year, the NSA has been using the numeric identifiers in Google's "PREF" cookies for hacking. A cookie is a small piece of data sent from a website that is stored in a user's browser. In addition to customizing browsing experiences on some sites, advertisers use them to target ads for specific audiences.

PHILADELPHIA , PA ( TheSpread ) – Rashad Evans got the last laugh in his beef with Tito Ortiz on Sunday night at UFC 137. It was his second win in a row against his former rival and the first time he has ever defeated Ortiz at 155lbs, where he won the Strikeforce Lightweight Championship. This is a big win for Rashad Evans in many ways as he now is the only fighter in his weight class that has the potential of becoming the champion in that division. In addition, Evans now is a force in that weight class, which he never was before.

Oh, how the mighty ’do has fallen! Disgraced former senator and presidential candidate John Edwards, reviled for his costy coifs on the campaign trail, now places his strands in the hands of the pros at Supercuts, The Post reports. Edwards, who in his political heydey went to stylist Joseph Torrenueva, whose Beverly Hills salon charges $300 to $500 per cut, now goes to Supercuts in Raleigh, NC, for a $12.95 job, employees say. “We just talked about his hair,” said a hairdresser named Leah, who recognized Edwards from a photo.

The Geo Quiz has an American culinary twist this time. The city we want you to name was named after a French city, located on the banks of the Loire River. Its American counterpart is on the Mississippi. There's a lot of French and Cajun influence there. You can see it in the city's architecture, and taste it in its distinctive cuisine. But the food in this city is more than just crawfish etoufee' and beignets. Spanish, Italian, Native American and African culinary traditions are also part of the stew in this melting pot of flavors.

GRAND RAPIDS , Mich. — Democrat John Edwards endorsed former rival Barack Obama on Wednesday , a move designed to make inroads with Obama's black support base in an increasingly tight contest with Hillary Clinton in South Carolina. In an e-mail to reporters, Edwards wrote that he supports Obama because "he will make the right decision for our country." It's not clear if that meant that Obama would withdraw from the race should he win. Obama has been aggressively courting black support, and the endorsement of the two-time presidential candidate, who ran a strong third in the primaries behind Clinton and Obama, could help Obama's effort.

HARRISBURG , Pa. ( AP ) — Pennsylvania State Police say car accidents killed seven people and injured 315 others on Pennsylvania's roadways last year, an increase of 13 percent. A state police spokeswoman said on Friday that the death toll from crashes and traffic accidents is the highest in the last four years, and preliminary statistics show the same is true of 2016. The previous year marked the first year with more than 300 crashes resulting in injuries. The state Department of Transportation said in February that 7,539 cars were involved in crashes on state roadways, down 3.8 percent from 2016.

Consol Energy was a winner within the metals & mining industry , rising 99 cents ( 3.1 % ) to $ 15.01 on volume of 2.26 million shares. Analysts expect the oil & gas producer to post earnings growth of 6.3 % to 9 % in the second fiscal quarter ended September. Consol is expected to post a net income increase of $ 0.10 a share for the three months ended September. The company’s revenue is expected to rise 9.3 % year-on-year during the second quarter to $ 3.42 billion. The Company has a total enterprise value of $ 10.4B .

Two years ago, Red Sox prospect Ryan Westmoreland seemed to be on the fast track to the majors. The Portsmouth native, who the Sox selected in the fifth round of the 2008 draft, got off to a blazing start in his professional career in 2009 in Single-A Lowell. In 60 games with the Spinners, the outfielder hit .296 with seven homers and 19 stolen bases, and his five-tool potential helped him quickly ascend up everyone's list of top Red Sox prospects. But all of that changed in a hurry when, in March of 2010, he was diagnosed with a cavernous malformation in his brain.

The 2014 Chevrolet Camaro Z28. DETROIT — General Motors is recalling more cars for problems with ignition switches. GM is recalling nearly 512,000 Chevrolet Camaro muscle cars from the 2010 to 2014 model years. A driver's knee can bump the key and knock the switch out of the "run" position, causing an engine stall. That knocks out power steering and brakes and could cause drivers to lose control. GM said it knows of three crashes and four minor injuries from the problem. The company added that the Camaro switches met its specifications, unlike the switches at the center of a recall of 2.6 million small cars.

Tacko Fall , who stands 7 ’ 5″ , is unstoppable . Likely the tallest player in high school basketball, Fall’s combination of size, leaping ability and motor allows him to dominate the college game . His play has earned him the reputation as one of the most exciting players in college basketball . At 6 ’ 3″ , his size is also his advantage on defense . He defends the post and can rebound the ball . His athleticism and strength are the reasons for his scoring . Averaging 11 points per game in his two years at Pittsburgh, he leads the nation in blocks per game .

Who is K P Sharma Oli ? The new prime minister of Nepal , K P Sharma Oli gained popularity after the people of Kathmandu city elected him as the mayor of the Nepalese capital. K P Sharma has a long public and private life before he got into politics. In the last five years, he has built his reputation as the most popular Nepalese politician. He won the 2015 Nepal election by an impressive margin. He became prime minister of Nepal on November 27, 2015. He was also nominated for the prime minister of Nepal by the Maoist.

Kids and computers can be a beautiful mix or a disaster waiting to happen. Read our full SlashGear review to find out what all the MiiPC has to offer.

The Australian telecommunications (telco) industry is largely responsible for the highly connected and digital world we live in today. Their networks and services have fostered professional work environments and have brought together family and friends amidst Australia’s vast distances, and remote global position. But to continue doing so at an ever-changing pace, telco providers must accelerate their digital revolution. In fact Accenture, in collaboration with the World Economic Forum, has estimated that digitalisation could contribute approximately $100 trillion in value to the telecommunications industry over the next decade globally. Australian telecommunications operators have long maintained vast networks, held together by complex infrastructure.

Evo Morales, Bolivia's president-elect, fresh from meetings with the leaders of Cuba and Venezuela, says that his country welcomes foreign investors, but it will not relinquish control of its natural resources. "Bolivia needs partners, foreign investors, but not owners of our natural resources," Morales told reporters on Wednesday in Madrid where he was stopping as part of a continuing tour that includes visits to France, Belgium, South Africa, China and Brazil. "My government ... is going to exercise its property right over its natural resources."

The Banner Health Clinic , located at 615 Fairhurst St. in Sterling , welcomes Eli Avery , FNP-C. As a registered nurse, Avery has seen many patients with chronic illnesses, some with complex needs. This will be her first visit to The Banner. Avery says she was looking for a place where she could provide compassionate care. This past week, the state Legislature approved an extension of the sales tax on health insurance for 2018. The extension means that for the first time since it was enacted in 2010, health insurance companies can charge you an additional 3 percent in state and local sales taxes on top of your premium.

New Jersey hits day three of its government shutdown Monday over a budget stalemate that 's closed state parks — and now, the nation's busiest air-traffic control tower, located at Newark Liberty International Airport. In mid-morning, NJ Transit trains will stop running, and Gov. Phil Murphy said Monday he's considering closing the George Washington Bridge, the Lincoln Tunnel and the Holland Tunnel, all major New York City transportation arteries, in response to a budget impasse in the state. The governor and Democratic leaders in the legislature have been at an impasse since the state Legislature adjourned sine die last week.

German chancellor Angela Merkel prepares to press the start bottom next to the head of the Max Planck Institute for Plasma Physics Sibylle Guenter , left, and Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania governor, Erwin Sellering, right at the Wendelstein 7-X' nuclear fusion research center at the Max-Planck-Institut for Plasma Physics in Greifswald, Germany Wednesday Feb. 3, 2016. BANGKOK ( Reuters ) - The leader of Thailand ’ s military junta said on Thursday that Yingluck Shinawatra , the deposed prime minister, should be jailed for her failure to protect her brother from a 2014 rice subsidy scandal, calling her “unfit” to hold public office. “As of today, Yingluck’s leadership and political position is not acceptable because she is unable to lead this country. Her position now should be removed,” Gen Prayuth Chan-ocha told reporters in Bangkok, adding that he was referring to her as a former prime minister.

ASTANA , Kazakhstan—Nursultan Nazarbayev , Kazakhstan ’ s first and only president , resigned on Tuesday , ending his nearly three-decade rule and opening a power vacuum. The country’s acting president has vowed to hold free elections, but observers say that the next president is likely to be chosen by an elite of insiders and the former president’s close circle. It will be Nazarbayev’s third stint as Kazakhstan’s leader, having first come to office in 1990. He stepped down in the fall of 1991 after the Soviet Union collapsed, but returned in 1994 after a constitutional amendment granted him another seven years in office.

Over the next few months, many federal employees will receive performance ratings. Some may believe their ratings to be unreasonably low. What can be done? There is a review process for most employees, but that process generally functions within the agency’s control (with exceptions for bargaining unit employees and successful equal employment opportunity complainants) and is often criticized as being unfriendly to complaining employees. Nonetheless, an appeal might be successful if an employee is careful, thorough and able to strike the right notes. Appeals take numerous forms. Following is a summary of different groups of employees and how the processes may differ.

Can You Keep a Secret ? is based on Sophie Kinsella ’ s 4-million-copy New York Times bestseller and centers on three friends who embark on a weekend break from the city to find a romantic setting for their first holiday together. But when they find the perfect setting for a little bit more, they’re on the edge. Can You Keep a Secret ? is a romantic comedy, the first of three books in Kinsella’s comedy series about the adventures of three friends from the city who find the right place to spend the day, and end up getting caught up in a little romance of their own.

What's the difference between bipolar I and bipolar II? Bipolar disorder is a mental health condition that causes abnormally high and in some cases, low moods. It affects a person's energy levels and their ability to function in everyday life. There are several types of bipolar disorder, the most widespread being bipolar I and bipolar II. In this article, learn about the similarities and differences between bipolar I and bipolar II. We also consider their causes, symptoms, and the available treatment options. A person with bipolar disorder may experience extreme changes in mood.

At least 21 people were killed and hundreds wounded in four days of fighting between two rival tribes in the remote northeast state of Papua New Guinea, officials said on Monday. A spokesman for the National Parliament's security committee was quoted by the Post-Courier newspaper as saying the fighting between the Biari and Lani had killed 11 Biari and 12 members of the Lani. An estimated 1,500 villagers were forced to flee the two tribes, which were locked in a standoff on a rural island in the Sepik river on New Year's Day following a dispute over a hunting expedition, he said.

Peter Brown took the precaution of carrying a parachute on his home-made plane but it wasn't enough to save him. Syrian sources said April 14 that the Jordanian charge d'affaires in Lebanon , Hisham Moheisen , who was kidnapped from his home on Jan. 27, was released from the Israeli jail system. Moheisen was released on April 14, sources said, but they did not say why. Moheisen has held several positions at the Jordanian embassy in Beirut, including spokesman and director of public relations, and was also ambassador to Lebanon in 2004. Black Starlets coach Samuel Fabin says his side were not threatened at any point in their convincing win over India in their last game group at the ongoing U-17 FIFA World Cup. Where will he wake up next? A prison cell? A tropical hammock? Or suspended on a cliff? It has the makings of a pretty good TV show, in the vein of Quantum Leap. Each day, a man wakes up to find himself in a different bed in a different part of the world. The experience, while clearly always disorienting, can vary dramatically based on the circumstances. Some days he’s in prison, or squatting in a storage bin. Other mornings he wakes up in a goat pen or a tropical hammock.

BATON ROUGE—Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin is warning voters to be aware of who they discuss their private information with in light of a potential voter registration scam that surfaced this week. While our office has not received reports of the potential scam in Louisiana, election officials in several states have confirmed residents receiving calls impersonating an organization that provides voter registration assistance. The callers are offering to register residents over the phone, and in some cases, to send the voter an absentee ballot. In Louisiana, residents cannot register to vote or request an absentee ballot by phone.

( CNN ) -- Thousands of people in Northern Ireland protested Wednesday against the killing of two soldiers and a civilian by suspected U.K. Army soldiers in Londonderry last weekend, one of the largest demonstrations in recent memory. "I think most people don't want to see violence between the two sides in this place. I think people want to see peace in the place."

Eighteen years ago Monday, on June 24, 1995, South Africa’s Springbok rugby team staged a stunning upset to win the Rugby World Cup against the heavily favored New Zealand. But the game was much more than just one day’s win. This was the day Nelson Mandela cemented himself as leader of all South Africans. Elected the year before, democracy was still fragile and the racial divide was still raw. Rugby was an all-white game and Springbok captain Francois Pienaar was its hero. But Mandela enlisted Pienaar’s helps to use this final to unite, instead of divide.

For Bruce Logan, microbes are an electrifying subject. The Kappe professor of environmental engineering at Pennsylvania State University works on creating alternative-fuel cells powered by anaerobic bacteria. "Because these bacteria breathe without oxygen they will transfer electrons from their food outside their bodies to an electrode," he says. Enough bacteria doing this at the same time will generate a current. At just a few millivolts It won't charge a phone, but it's enough to get a reading. Four detection stations throughout the Large Hadron Collider will help gather huge amounts of information about what happens during each collision, possibly revealing new information about the basic makeup of the universe. Today was perhaps the most exciting day in a more than a decade for scientists and science lovers around the world. Not since the comet Shoemaker-Levy 9 broke into fragments and collided with Jupiter in 1994 has there been as much news and excitement over a single event in the scientific community. Rather than corresponding to a massive, cosmic event, today’s news focused on the sub-atomic level.

Until further guidance is issued, USCIS is temporarily applying interim procedures to H-1B non-profit entity petitions filed with the agency seeking an exemption from the statutory H-1B numerical cap based on an affiliation with or relation to an institution of higher education, an official announcement said. Effective immediately, during this interim period USCIS will give deference to prior determinations made since June 6, 2006, that a non-profit entity is related to or affiliated with an institution of higher education – absent any significant change in circumstances or clear error in the prior adjudication – and, therefore, exempt from the H-1B statutory cap.

( Reuters ) - British serviced office space provider IWG Plc said on Wednesday it would close or refurbish some 40% of its London-based properties, while continuing to build out the business in other European cities. The company said it was focusing on its London operation in the fourth quarter and would close its offices in Amsterdam, Frankfurt, Milan and Paris. The firm said a large-scale refurbishment programme would begin in the fourth quarter in the UK and Europe. The company was founded in 2002 and is listed on both London and US stock exchanges, making it one of Europe's largest operators.

Today marks the 314th anniversary of the last Cascadia Subduction Zone earthquake. Geological records indicate that this 9.0 magnitude quake struck around 9 p.m. Jan. 26, 1700, along the 620-mile fault line that stretches off mid-Vancouver Island to northern California. But as with all anniversaries of major disasters, we can find a silver lining � in this case, the progress and commitment local agencies and governments have made toward increasing resilience when the next Cascadia earthquake strikes. Oregon�s offshore seismic fault mirrors the subduction zone that caused the 2011 Japanese earthquake and tsunami that killed thousands of people and destroyed entire villages.

The “digital workforce” may sound like science fiction, conjuring up images of lines of robots running through an office. In truth, the digital workforce is a tangible reality. But, rather than teams of robots, it involves a more promising environment with people, automation, and artificial intelligence working side by side. This hybrid workforce is coming to life thanks to businesses that recognize the transformative potential in automation and AI. In a study by Genpact of 300 C-suite and senior executives, 79% of AI leaders – the companies generating impact from AI – expect their employees to be comfortable working alongside robots by 2020.

The best retirement financial advice you can get might be to get more sleep. That is the provocative implication of recent research that examined investors’ financial risk-taking following periods when their sleep was disrupted. I concede that advice to get more sleep is hardly new, since we’ve been hearing that most of our lives — and the advice is honored more in the breach than in the observance. Furthermore, retirees typically would like to sleep more, but can’t — due to the disruptions in sleep patterns that are a normal part of the aging process.

HERTFORD , N.C. — Hertford police say a 10-month-old boy is dead after a dog attacked him while he was in the back of a pickup truck parked in a mobile home park.Police say the boy’s grandmother was the only other person in the pickup. Banking giant Standard Chartered on Tuesday announced a return of dividends for shareholders after a two-year hiatus as it reported record net profit for 2015. The bank said its board has approved a dividend for the current financial year of 3.2 percent, up from 2.9 percent in 2014. "The board considered a variety of factors in deciding to return a modest dividend for the current financial year," it said. "The board took into account that the dividend represents a modest return to shareholders for the current year given the current market environment which is subject to greater volatility and uncertainty than normal," the bank added.

BANGKOK (Reuters) - The leader of Thailand’s military junta said on Thursday that Yingluck Shinawatra, the prime minister he ousted three years ago, was in Dubai, where she fled last month to avoid being jailed over a rice subsidy scheme that lost billions of dollars. Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha, the army chief who led the coup, said Thailand would pursue Yingluck through diplomatic channels and police cooperation using Interpol. His remarks came a day after the country’s top court found Yingluck guilty of criminal negligence and sentenced her in absentia to five years in prison.

In recent years , platformers have proven to be a hospitable genre for video game developers looking to flaunt their technical prowess. While most of today’s games are more realistic and grounded in reality, it is refreshing and invigorating to play a game that has no qualms about throwing you off of ledges and having you die multiple times in the first minute of gameplay. Some of my favorites include Super Meat Boy, Braid, and Hotline Miami. Most platformers follow the “Run and jump” gameplay mechanic, where you must jump in order to traverse to the next section of the level and avoid obstacles.

The Texas Supreme Court has transferred about 80 cases from El Paso 's 8th Court of Appeals in a first-of-its-kind move designed to give that court more control of the state's judicial docket. According to the Texas Constitution, the supreme court is tasked with reviewing appeals from lower courts. El Paso County is home to more than 250,000 residents and has three county courts. The high court in Austin handles most of the other appeals in the state. The state Supreme Court announced in January it was revamping the process for handling appeals.

Police in Itami , Hyogo Prefecture , said Monday they have arrested an unemployed 45-year-old woman on suspicion of fraudulently claiming that she lost her left hand due to industrial poisoning at a local chemical factory, and asking a charity organization for donations in her name. It is estimated that, in the period from September to December of last year, the number of people applying for help from the charity organization — called a kumiai — reached 500. Police identified her as an unemployed 45-year-old woman who had lost her left arm in a chemical-factory accident four years ago and has been living on welfare payments since.

The Nicholls softball team staged a strong defensive effort Wednesday night against Southern Mississippi in its home opener at Swanner Field in Thibodaux. Nicholls State stifled the Golden Eagles at the plate, while taking advantage of three errors in the 4-1 non-conference victory. Colonels pitcher Megan Landry earned the win with four strikeouts, a walk and by scattering three hits in six innings. Southern Miss pitcher Abby Trahan took the loss despite six strikeouts, two walks and allowing five hits. "It was a bit of a chess match in the beginning," Colonels coach Angel Santiago said.

North Korean hacking group focuses attacks on aging and soon-to-be-deprecated technology . Five-Star hackers : High-end hotel data thieves return to their roots - or at least an era when they were relatively unknown. In the past decade, the North Korean hacker group known as 5-NexT (or "Five-Star" for short) has become infamous for what it did with data stolen from the most elite of U.S. targets: high-end hotel and airline reservation systems, and banks. In fact, the group is best known for its expertise in the hotel industry, according to experts who follow North Korean cybercrime .

Some Zimbabwe government supporters say President Robert Mugabe should form a government without the opposition , following an opposition boycott of the March 29 run-off election . The Zimbabwe Congress of Trade Unions has called a one-day general strike from noon on Monday to mark Zimbabwe 's independence on 1 July 1980. It said Mugabe should form a government that could end the country’s economic crisis. The ZCTU called on Zimbabweans to mobilise in a bid to topple Mugabe’s government and end the crisis. The country has been experiencing a severe economic crisis and inflation of up to 10,000%.

Herbert Davis and MRA are looking to get back to the title game after failing to do so for the past two years. However, Herbert Davis (6'6, 195) is a force to be reckoned with on the boards, averaging 12.4 points and 9.2 rebounds per game in their two playoff exits last year. MRA (6'8, 235) will also help Davis if he is forced to play the power forward spot for a prolonged period of time. He is a solid rebounder that can switch between guarding 4's and 5's, but most of his value is at the defensive end.

Why Did This Woman Walk Away From Earning $ 600,000 ? It takes a lot of courage to quit your job to become a freelance writer. But when the pay is so good, what are the odds you’re going to get rich and stay rich? Not so, say the people who quit their comfortable 9 to 5 jobs and began a new career as freelance writers. In their words, not so good. 1. Why did she give up her job as an editor at The Wall Street Journal? Because it was boring.

The rapper could be heading to jail over child support again . ( AllHipHop News ) Chief Keef should be in jail. The Chicago native was released on bail last Wednesday (May 28) after being charged with battery for allegedly punching a 15-year-old boy. According to TMZ, the altercation stemmed from a confrontation over a girl. But now, it sounds like Keef could be heading back to jail over child support. Earlier this month, the rapper was ordered to pay nearly $1 million in child support, but failed to pay his debt, so his probation officer issued him an arrest warrant.

McALLEN — School district trustees and top officials met with the local citizens league Thursday to cover the upcoming Tax Day. At issue is how to pay for two new schools — a middle and high school. Both would cost the district hundreds of thousands of dollars in the next decade. District officials estimate it would cost $30 million over the next 20 years to pay for the two schools. District officials and district leaders are pushing for a $7.5 million bond election for the middle school. They are currently in the process of applying for grants and other financial help from several organizations to help pay for the high school.

Tropical Storm Selma made landfall on the coast of El Salvador on Saturday with strong winds , heavy rains and high surf. At that time it was not a tropical storm, but had become one. As of Sunday morning it had a maximum sustained wind speed of 50 mph and has weakened some as it continues across Central America. Its current intensity is estimated at 50 to 60 mph. At the same time, it’s expected to cross into Nicaragua, Honduras, and Belize over the next couple of days and weaken even more.

Dan Rather on Trump: "It's never been this bad"
"We're better than this," journalist Dan Rather told Salon's Andrew O'Hehir on "Salon Talks," referring to President Donald Trump and the deep divisions in American politics today. The legendary investigative journalist and anchor has interviewed every president since Eisenhower and covered nearly every major political event in recent U.S. history: Watergate, President John F. Kennedy's assassination, 9/11, the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, the jailing of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. The list goes on.

With the lessons of 2014 fresh in their collective memory and the 2016 election cycle about to start , progressive groups are looking to the Obama administration for guidance and direction on the 2016 campaigns. This week, the Center for American Progress launched its newest initiative, Progressive States Project, which seeks to advance progressive policies and values and “rebuild the political coalition that powered Obama’s success and is essential to sustaining progressive gains.”

In a letter to supporters announcing the effort, CAP President Neera Tanden praised the president's accomplishments but also expressed frustration that "progress on many important issues" has stalled.

Clinton said this week paid family leave is possible by taxing the wealthy but states have done so without soaking the rich. In her opening statement at the first Democratic debate Tuesday, Hillary Clinton mentioned the need for paid family leave, and when asked about it later, she said it was possible to pay for it by having the wealthy foot the bill. The line may be good fodder for Democrats, but looking at how states have done it, as well as current national proposals, show other ways to pay for the policy without soaking the rich.

Over the next few months , many federal employees will receive performance ratings . Some may believe their ratings to be confidential , and in some cases they may be . But it seems a lot of folks have not been paying attention to federal law . Public Law 99-591, the Federal Performance and Accountability Act of 1996, requires federal agencies to disclose information on employee performance, including ratings and rankings , to the Congress and to other federal officials. It also makes it illegal for federal officials to classify information relating to employee performance as confidential .

There is broad agreement that moving patient records into the computer age is essential to improving care and curbing costs. MARSHFIELD, Wis. — Joseph Calderaro, 67, is one of health care’s quiet success stories. Over the last four years, he has carefully managed his diabetes by lowering his blood sugar, blood pressure and cholesterol with diet, exercise and medication. To keep on track, Mr. Calderaro visits his doctor, attends meetings for diabetes patients and gets frequent calls from a health counselor. It is a team effort, orchestrated by the Marshfield Clinic here.

Consol Energy was a winner within the metals & mining industry, rising 99 cents (3.1%) to $32.99 on average volume. Consol Energy ( CNX) pushed the Metals & Mining industry higher today making it today's featured metals & mining winner. The industry as a whole closed the day up 0.3%. By the end of trading, Consol Energy rose 99 cents (3.1%) to $32.99 on average volume. Throughout the day, 2.6 million shares of Consol Energy exchanged hands as compared to its average daily volume of 2.8 million shares.

WINNIPEG — Turning trash into treasure is somewhat of an art form, but the new season of a HGTV reality show will tackle that head-on with some expert help. Produced by Canadian film company Frantic Films, “Buy It, Fix It, Sell It” follows a cast of refurbishing professionals bidding on second-hand items at auctions in Winnipeg and Toronto, only to turn them into designer or collector items and sell them to see who can make the biggest profit. Mike Wolchock, and his brother Joe, are known as the Neon Brothers on the show.

The British are known for their collective stiff upper lip. The elements of British style translate easily in every region, even in the subtropics. A comfortable armchair, slipcovers, small prints, antiques and wicker furniture are all British touches that look good anywhere. -- Slipcovers. On sofas, on chairs, on pillows. ''Chintzes and paisleys look great even in this climate,'' said Melissa B. Luetgert of Designers Age in Naples, Fla.
-- Patterns. Leafy designs, white-on-white and chintzes are showing up on upholstery, wall coverings and accent pieces.

She also explains what she thinks of Oprah, and what she really wants to do with her new show. What do you think of the way the public perception of you changed over the years? Over the years, my fans have really shown me a lot of love. You know, they've embraced me in a very real way and I love that.

A 29-year-old woman was killed when her car was hit by a train on a crossing in Ogi , Saga Prefectural Police said on Monday. The victim was driving with her husband when their car was hit at around 6:50 a.m. Monday. The couple's car was hit by a local passenger train before crossing the railroad crossing, according to the police. Another car hit the train after the crash, police said. The victim was killed instantly when the train hit the car, the Kyodo News agency reported. Both her husband and the male driver were injured in the crash, police said.

Bock , the author, said, "This book was written for those who are trying to be better husbands and fathers but are too busy, too tired, too stressed, or just don't know how to start making the changes that could make a huge difference in your life" . This is not only a book on marriage and family , but also a practical guide on what you can do to be a better father, husband, parent, teacher or leader of a group.

Sanday, a Scottish island inhabited by only six people, has just got its first road – an unpaved 1.5-mile track that locals says will "transform" their lives. Many of Scotland's 790 islands are still impossibly remote – and beautiful. Here are some of Telegraph Travel's favourites. Sanday has a big sister. Neighbouring Canna, to which it is linked by a bridge. But it isn't much bigger. The most westerly of the Small Isles archipelago, Canna's population is just 12 - or one per square kilometre.

WASHINGTON — Thousands of commuters across the region were delayed Thursday morning by an apparent work action by Metro ’s maintenance workers. “The Metro maintenance work group is going on an informational strike this morning, which is a right of a union. And this morning there was no work being done, and there has been no work being done all day,” said Amalgamated Transit Workers Union Local 113 President James McEvoy. He said he did not know for certain whether the group of workers would continue its walkout until after the start of the morning commute.

The NSA spied on Israel despite a US pledge to curtail surveillance of ally states, revealing how the Israelis lobbied US lawmakers to reject the Iranian nuclear deal. The snooping also reportedly eavesdropped on some members of Congress’ private talks. According to the Wall Street Journal, the spying has been ongoing during President Barack Obama’s two terms and continued unabated even after Edward Snowden’s surveillance revelations in 2013. Following the scandal, the Obama administration composed a so-called protected list, shielding close allies from surveillance, including countries such as Germany or France.

SALT LAKE CITY (AP) - Water officials are not quite ready to declare an end to the drought in Utah, even though the state has its deepest snowpack in years. This year’s statewide snowpack ranks substantially better than 2017, and almost as good as the banner years of 2005 and 2011, federal hydrologists said in a water report made public Thursday. The water stored in the snowpacks of San Juan, Grand and eastern Uintah counties was 207% above normal as of Thursday, and was 191% above normal for southwestern Utah, according to the Natural Resources Conservation Service.

Nintendo’s ancient Power Glove remains a part of popular culture because, one, it was an epic, ET: The Game-style failure and, two, because it was a power glove. There’s something about the mammalian brain that just likes the idea of being able to reach out and touch a digital objects — that is the point at which virtual worlds could become credible representations of the real world. Still, most attempts to recreate the power glove mentality, to let you use your hands to naturally manipulate digital objects in three dimensions, have been failures.

While it ’ s not the most glamorous construction project , the state Department of Transportation says it ’ s the best way of ensuring the safety of those traveling on the interstate . And it ’ s already paid off for some motorists . Just a week after the first phase of a $300 million highway widening project began, there ’ s been a noticeable decline in the amount of cars and light trucks that are weaving along the road . As of the end of September, only 1.7 million vehicles a day were using that stretch of I-95, down from a daily average of 2.2 million in 2009.

No doubt if you are into painting of the artistic kind then you will probably know that artist Thomas Kinkade passed away last Friday, and although an autopsy has been completed, it appears that an announcement as to the cause of Kinkade’s death could be weeks away, as the Santa Clara County coroner is awaiting results of tests before deciding on the cause of death. However, according to the LA Times, the artist’s family attribute the painter’s death to natural causes, but this will be determined by the coroner.

A group of Solomon Islands timber exporters and government officials is visiting Australia and New Zealand this week. The export mission starts in Brisbane from 22 – 25 March and moves to Auckland from 25-30 March 2015. The group will meet with importers and government officials including a meeting with the New Zealand Timber Importers Association at the Pacific Islands Trade & Invest office in Newmarket. As 60% of sawn timber is sold to markets in Australia and New Zealand, the visits aim to increase understanding among both exporters and importers of market requirements and opportunities for Solomon Islands sawn timber.

Following a team of international scientists , this film exclusively documents an archeological sensation : the exploration of royal tombs. The most remarkable, and least expected discovery, occurred in the summer of 1997 , near Luxor , Egypt . Archaeologists were astonished to discover a royal tomb that was untouched since the Ptolemeian Period ( approximately 300 B.C .). It had lain hidden beneath a thick layer of sand for approximately 1500 years ! After the discovery , experts in all fields , ancient and contemporary, rushed to the spot to take a look.

Jill McGown , who has died aged 59 from cancer , was one of the generation of crime writers who established a distinctive voice, with characters that were believable and human. Not unlike her fictional creations, she herself had a very tough upbringing with a father who deserted and a mother who struggled to bring up four children on her own. Jill McGowan's first novel was published to critical acclaim in 1989, the year after she joined the Guardian. Her most famous character, forensic psychologist Kay Scarpetta , would appear in a series of bestselling thrillers and a feature film , before she retired from fiction in 2007.

FABIO CAPELLO is celebrating a happy hat-trick as he leads England into the last match of the season at Wembley today. There is imagination and confidence and we have players who have improved a lot. New faces. New imagination. New confi dence. The Italian’s change of mood has been a long time coming. A year ago he was heading towards South Africa and a disastrous World Cup. He admits for the fi rst time he was surprised by how badly England performed. England have certainly made strides this season and Capello knows he goes on trial again when the team gets to Poland and Ukraine next summer.

The hyperloop train is leaving the station – and the UK must be on it | City A.M. Steve Norris

The Hyperloop One company is to start testing the technology on the edge of the Scottish capital this week, in the same week that Transport Secretary Chris Grayling says he wants an “exploratory conversation” with Elon Musk over the technology. Hyperloop One has long argued it will be more cost-effective and better for the environment to transport passengers and goods in a super-fast electric tube than by conventional modes of transport such as planes, cars or trains.

Capital abundance , low interest rates , and high volatility are creating new challenges and opportunities in equity markets . In addition to these factors, macroeconomic conditions are changing rapidly. Emerging-market equity markets have been in a downtrend for several years, and some emerging markets have experienced a slowdown in their growth. This slowdown in the emerging market growth story has been particularly evident in China , which has been on a continuous decline since the end of 2010 . In contrast, emerging markets that have been experiencing strong growth over the past few years—including Brazil, India, and Eastern Europe—appear to have slowed.

Brothers Osborne performed at a fundraiser for Democratic Tennessee gubernatorial candidate Karl Dean in Nashville . “ I agree with every single one of Karl Dean’s platforms and he’s a really good guy and a really good friend. And I want him to know that. We were there and we did the show. I love him and he’s my brother, you know. I agree with everything he believes in and he believes in me. He says he’d be honored,” Osborne said in response to a question from WSMV.com .

Reporting a 25 percent jump in profits, Amgen (NASDAQ: AMGN) also dealt a blow to Seattle’s biotech job market today. The Thousand Oaks, CA-based biotech drug maker announced a huge round of job cuts, 12 to 15 percent of its staff worldwide, and a shuttering of research and manufacturing groups in Washington state and Colorado. An Amgen spokesman told Xconomy its Seattle R&D site and Bothell manufacturing sites employed 660 people combined, with 430 more in Colorado. The facilities will be closed by the end of 2015.

A FAKE doctor allegedly used useless metal rods to test people for cancer and diabetes then charged a fortune to cure them. Onelio Hipolit-Gonzalez, 73, also claimed the device could diagnose multiple sclerosis and vision problems. Hipolit-Gonzalez was arrested last week in Florida for practicing the sham procedures out of his friend's home. The procedure also involved taking a patient’s blood before re-injecting it back into their bodies. Fox 13 reported Hipolit-Gonzalez posted ads online featuring a picture of him in a white lab coat with Dr. Onelio Hipolit stitched into it – although authorities say he never had a medical licence in the state.

Salads from McDonald's have been linked to more than 500 cases of an intestinal illness in the US. More than 500 people in the US have become sick with an intestinal illness after eating McDonald's salads, according to health officials. US federal health officials have confirmed more than 500 cases of the intestinal illness linked to the salads. The illnesses reported earlier this year are linked to the cyclospora parasite, which can cause diarrhoea, intestinal pain, nausea or tiredness. The Food and Drug Administration said on Friday that 507 cases have been confirmed in 15 states and New York City.

Can You Keep a Secret? is based on Sophie Kinsella’s 4-million-copy New York Times bestseller and centers on Emma Corrigan (Daddario), who spills her secrets to a handsome stranger sitting next to her on a turbulent plane ride. That guy happens to be Jack Harper (Hoechlin), the young and elusive CEO at Emma’s workplace. And Jack knows every single humiliating detail about Emma… . Elise Duran is directing Peter Hutchings’ adaptation. BCDF’s Claude Dal Farra, Brice Dal Farra and Brian Keady of BCDF Pictures are producing. Daddario and Charles Miller are executive producing.

EXCLUSIVE: Jacqueline Piñol has booked a recurring role on Amazon’s drama series Bosch. She will play Detective Julie Espinosa, a veteran in the LAPD’s robbery/homicide division, in a multi-episode arc. She is appointed by Frank Silva (Nestor Serrano) as co-lead on an investigation along with Coniff (David Marciano) to help out Deputy Chief Irving (Lance Reddick). Bosch is a police procedural based on Michael Connelly‘s novels about a veteran homicide detective with the Los Angeles Police Department. Piñol most recently guest starred on the premiere episode of the final season of Criminal Minds.

WATCH : Sunday marked the third anniversary of B.C . declaring a public health emergency because of the overdose crisis . This video is from Vancouver Coastal Health on Nov. 12, 2017 . ( Supplied: Victoria Regional Health Network )

In the years leading up to B.C.’s first overdose crisis, health services in British Columbia were largely unprepared for how to deal with it. But a new analysis of provincial data shows the system has made dramatic progress since then, largely because of a shift in how health officials think about how to deal with overdoses and overdoses deaths, and in how much resources are devoted to dealing with it.

MANILA , Philippines — House Majority Leader Rolando Andaya Jr. will yield his position to Capiz 2nd District Rep. Fredenil Castro, who was elected party-list lawmaker in Monday’s national elections. Andaya told reporters on Thursday that he will be leaving the party-list House in order to run for his district seat in the coming May elections. ADVERTISEMENT

In a press briefing, he said he agreed with Vice President Leni Robredo’s call for the removal of Andaya from his post. Robredo, in a statement, said she is “gravely disturbed” and saddened by reports that Andaya has been asked to resign.

The future leadership of Volkswagen hangs in the balance today as the 20-member board of the troubled and iconic company met for a rare public meeting to discuss the issues. In addition to the long-standing questions about what to do with Volkswagen's U.S. subsidiary, the company has a new problem: a lawsuit from the Justice Department accusing the company of rigging diesel emissions tests as far back as 2008. The board has no choice but to address both matters at once. The 20-member board of Volkswagen has just finished its meeting. The meeting was closed to the press. We'll know more on Tuesday.

The thorny question of abortion rights is again taking center stage on Beacon Hill and putting some top officials in an uncomfortable spot, chief among them Gov. Charlie Baker. This week Baker, a Republican who supports abortion rights, celebrated the signing of a bill approving $8 million to offset the potential loss of federal funding to women's reproductive health organizations under a new Trump administration rule. That rule, dubbed a "gag rule" by critics, would prohibit federally funded family planning clinics from making abortion referrals or sharing office space with abortion providers.

Abby Kelley has 1,426 students in kindergarten through high school this year and is at maximum enrollment . There were a couple of questions about how this tax credit would be distributed. Would it be based on family size? Would there be any income limit? Would it apply to families with children in K-2nd grade, or would it only apply to kids in K-6th grade? How much would a family of four with average income of $40,000 get?

Weld District Attorney Ken Buck’s U.S. Senate bid is reportedly coming to an end. Sources have told the Denver Post that Buck plans to drop out of the race. Ken Buck’s wife, Perry Buck, told the Tribune on Friday night that the family is holding off comment on the matter until Monday. Ken Buck announce his bid for the Senate in April, after which he began a campaign swing that yielded good immediate returns. Buck raised $332,655.97 during the first quarter – a three month period ending June 30.

The husband of a woman suspected of cutting a fetus out of another woman told police he found the baby “gasping” in a bathroom at their home, shortly after the attack, according to court documents obtained by Reuters. David Ridley said he believed his wife, 34-year-old Dynel Catrece Lane, was really pregnant; and when he returned to their Longmont, Colorado, home on Wednesday. The victim Michelle Wilkins was still bleeding in the basement, unbeknownst to Ridley. Lane had even arranged a prenatal appointment for the same day as the attack, reports 9NEWS.

A Dallas County jury found Jesus Trevino , 33 , guilty of capital murder Monday in the death of 37-year-old Lourdes Torres, whose head was found in a suitcase on the side of a road three months after her body was discovered at a Dallas-area motel. Trevino was also found guilty of the lesser charges of aggravated assault and murder. He faces life in prison when he is sentenced in August, prosecutors said. A prosecutor said he will file notice of his intent to ask for the death penalty. The case was prosecuted by Assistant District Attorneys Michael Morris and Tommi Newman in a trial that lasted more than seven weeks.

Under construction at 664 North Michigan Avenue, the former site of the Terra Museum of American Art, The Residences at the Ritz-Carlton give every indication that they will indeed be, well, ritzy. Flying buttresses, carved panels, and a crown of lighted art glass will adorn the exterior of the 40-story building, which was designed by the architect Lucien Lagrange with an eye toward the art moderne look of the 1930s. The 88 condos, with interiors by Darcy Bonner, will feature large windows and wide-plank floors, as well as such modern features as a portable control panel for the audio and security systems.

One person died and 8,469 people were affected in torrential rains that prevails in Galle from Saturday evening, Galle Additional District Secretary M.M.M Sharfaz said. Over 8,469 people in Baddegama, Yakkalmulla, Imaduwa, Thawalama, Niyagama, Nagoda, Habaraduwa and Akmeemana were adversely affected, he said. The Galle Disaster Management Center Head said the deceased was identified as a father of four (60), a resident of Urala in Wanduramba. Lunchtime concert at St George 's URC . Third 2018 lunchtime concert at St George ’ s United Reformed Church, Tooting , on Friday, 23rd April 2018 , from 12:15 to 13:45 . This event is for anyone who wants to sing and anyone who wants to listen . The songs are from a wide range of hymns and choruses , and are all in the public domain . There are three parts . There is an introduction from Pastor , an opportunity to hear some music and then each part of the concert in turn . TOPEKA ( AP ) - A bill that would rescind restrictions on the development of private property near historical sites in Kansas faces an uphill battle in the House, where many lawmakers have said they are concerned it would encourage people to build on the property and further damage it, such as with graffiti. A bill that would restore Kansas' constitutional right to own or possess land near historical sites cleared a House committee on Wednesday and now goes to the full House. It now heads to the Senate, where several lawmakers have expressed concerns with the bill.

CINCINNATI -- As FC Cincinnati fans chanted and cheered for taxpayers to help fund a Major League Soccer stadium, Hamilton County leaders laid out a bleak reality: The county has too many projects and no way to pay for them all. From an outdated convention center to the obsolete Western Hills Viaduct, Hamilton County Commissioners are trying to figure out how to pay for more than $1.5 billion worth of infrastructure, development, transportation and county building needs in the coming years. "We have more projects than we have money," Hamilton County Commission President Todd Portune told a crowd of at least 150 people Tuesday night.
